member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AlignmentBaseline
member.summary: Specifies the alignment baseline for text and other inline content in SVG.
member.remarks: The 'alignment-baseline' property is defined in the CSS Line Layout Module 3 specification. SVG 2 introduces changes to the definition of this property.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AlignmentBaseline.Baseline
member.summary: Aligns the baseline of the box with the baseline of the parent box.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AlignmentBaseline.TextBottom
member.summary: Aligns the bottom of the box with the bottom of the parent's content area.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AlignmentBaseline.Middle
member.summary: Aligns the middle of the box with the middle of the parent's content area.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AlignmentBaseline.Central
member.summary: Aligns the central baseline of the box with the central baseline of the parent box.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AlignmentBaseline.TextTop
member.summary: Aligns the top of the box with the top of the parent's content area.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AlignmentBaseline.Ideographic
member.summary: Aligns the box's ideographic baseline with the parent's ideographic baseline.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AlignmentBaseline.Alphabetic
member.summary: Aligns the box's alphabetic baseline with the parent's alphabetic baseline.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AlignmentBaseline.Mathematical
member.summary: Aligns the box's mathematical baseline with the parent's mathematical baseline.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AngleUnits
member.summary: Specifies the units for angles used in defining the orientation of markers in SVG.
member.remarks: The 'orient' attribute of SVG markers can be specified in various angle units. This enum provides options for setting these units.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AngleUnits.Degrees
member.summary: Specifies the angle in degrees. One full circle is 360 degrees.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AngleUnits.Gradians
member.summary: Specifies the angle in gradians. One full circle is 400 gradians.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AngleUnits.Radians
member.summary: Specifies the angle in radians. One full circle is approximately 6.283 radians (2Ï€ radians).

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AngleUnits.None
member.summary: Indicates no specific angle unit. Used for default or context-based settings.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AnimationFill
member.summary: Specifies the behavior of the animation before and after its execution.
member.remarks: The 'fill' attribute in SVG animations controls what values are applied by the animation outside the time it is executing. This enum provides options for controlling these behaviors.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AnimationFill.Freeze
member.summary: The animation will apply the property values for the time the animation ended.
member.remarks: When set to 'freeze', the animation effect is retained after the animation completes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AnimationFill.Remove
member.summary: The animation will not apply any values after it finishes executing.
member.remarks: When set to 'remove', the animation effect is not retained and the element returns to its initial state.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AspectRatioAlign
member.summary: Specifies alignment types for the 'preserveAspectRatio' attribute in SVG.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AspectRatioAlign.None
member.summary: Indicates that no uniform scaling is applied; the aspect ratio is not preserved.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AspectRatioAlign.XMinYMin
member.summary: Aligns the minimum X and minimum Y of the viewBox with the smallest X and Y values of the viewport.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AspectRatioAlign.XMidYMin
member.summary: Aligns the midpoint X and minimum Y of the viewBox with the midpoint X and smallest Y value of the viewport.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AspectRatioAlign.XMaxYMin
member.summary: Aligns the maximum X and minimum Y of the viewBox with the largest X and smallest Y value of the viewport.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AspectRatioAlign.XMinYMid
member.summary: Aligns the minimum X and midpoint Y of the viewBox with the smallest X and midpoint Y value of the viewport.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AspectRatioAlign.XMidYMid
member.summary: Aligns the midpoint X and Y of the viewBox with the midpoint X and Y of the viewport.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AspectRatioAlign.XMaxYMid
member.summary: Aligns the maximum X and midpoint Y of the viewBox with the largest X and midpoint Y value of the viewport.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AspectRatioAlign.XMinYMax
member.summary: Aligns the minimum X and maximum Y of the viewBox with the smallest X and largest Y value of the viewport.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AspectRatioAlign.XMidYMax
member.summary: Aligns the midpoint X and maximum Y of the viewBox with the midpoint X and largest Y value of the viewport.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AspectRatioAlign.XMaxYMax
member.summary: Aligns the maximum X and maximum Y of the viewBox with the largest X and Y values of the viewport.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AspectRatioScaling
member.summary: Specifies the scaling behavior for SVG elements when preserving their aspect ratio.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AspectRatioScaling.Meet
member.summary: Scales the SVG element to fit within the viewport while preserving its aspect ratio. If the aspect ratio of the viewport does not match the element, extra space will be distributed evenly along the axis that has more space.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.AspectRatioScaling.Slice
member.summary: Scales the SVG element to fill the viewport while preserving its aspect ratio. If the aspect ratio of the viewport does not match the element, the element will be clipped to fit.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.BaseLineShift
member.summary: Specifies the vertical position of an element relative to its baseline in SVG.
member.remarks: The 'baseline-shift' attribute in SVG is used to adjust the vertical position of an element relative to its baseline, which is particularly useful in text rendering. This enum provides various options for shifting the baseline to achieve different text effects.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.BaseLineShift.Sub
member.summary: Aligns the baseline of the element with the subscript baseline of the parent's text.
member.remarks: When set to 'sub', the element is positioned slightly below the baseline, typically used for subscript text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.BaseLineShift.Super
member.summary: Aligns the baseline of the element with the superscript baseline of the parent's text.
member.remarks: When set to 'super', the element is positioned slightly above the baseline, typically used for superscript text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.BaseLineShift.Top
member.summary: Aligns the top of the element with the top of the line box.
member.remarks: Setting the value to 'top' aligns the top of the element with the highest item in the line box, often used for alignment with large font sizes or images within a line of text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.BaseLineShift.Center
member.summary: Centers the element in the line box.
member.remarks: 'center' vertically centers the element within the line box, useful for aligning text or inline elements with varying sizes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.BaseLineShift.Bottom
member.summary: Aligns the bottom of the element with the bottom of the line box.
member.remarks: Setting the value to 'bottom' aligns the bottom of the element with the lowest item in the line box, often used for alignment with elements of different heights within a line.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.BlendMode
member.summary: Specifies the blending modes available for combining images or elements in SVG.
member.remarks: Blending modes in SVG are used to determine how two layers are blended into each other. This enum provides a variety of options that control how the colors of the blended layers mix and produce different visual effects.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.BlendMode.Normal
member.summary: Displays the source image as is, without any blending.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.BlendMode.Multiply
member.summary: Multiplies the colors of the source image and the background. The result is a darker image.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.BlendMode.Screen
member.summary: Makes the dark parts of the source image lighter and the light parts unchanged.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.BlendMode.Overlay
member.summary: Combines Multiply and Screen blend modes to enhance contrast.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.BlendMode.Darken
member.summary: Darkens the background based on the source image's colors.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.BlendMode.Lighten
member.summary: Lightens the background based on the source image's colors.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.BlendMode.ColorDodge
member.summary: Brightens the background to reflect the source image.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.BlendMode.ColorBurn
member.summary: Darkens the background to reflect the source image.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.BlendMode.HardLight
member.summary: Creates a hard light effect based on the source image's brightness.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.BlendMode.SoftLight
member.summary: Creates a soft light effect based on the source image's brightness.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.BlendMode.Difference
member.summary: Highlights the differences between the source image and the background.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.BlendMode.Exclusion
member.summary: Creates an effect similar to Difference, but with lower contrast.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.BlendMode.Hue
member.summary: Uses the hue of the source image combined with the luminance and saturation of the background.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.BlendMode.Saturation
member.summary: Uses the saturation of the source image combined with the hue and luminance of the background.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.BlendMode.Color
member.summary: Uses the hue and saturation of the source image combined with the luminance of the background.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.BlendMode.Luminosity
member.summary: Uses the luminance of the source image combined with the hue and saturation of the background.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.CalcMode
member.summary: Specifies the calculation modes for interpolating values in SVG animations.
member.remarks: The calculation mode determines how an SVG animation transitions between values over the course of the animation. Different modes can be used to create various effects and control the animation's pacing and smoothness.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.CalcMode.Discrete
member.summary: The animation jumps from one value to the next without any interpolation.
member.remarks: In 'discrete' mode, the animation steps through the values, updating the attribute or property at each key time.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.CalcMode.Linear
member.summary: The animation values are interpolated linearly across the animation duration.
member.remarks: In 'linear' mode, the change between values is uniform, creating a steady transition.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.CalcMode.Paced
member.summary: The animation is paced so that the progress is even across the entire animation.
member.remarks: In 'paced' mode, the animation maintains a consistent speed, adjusting the timing of value changes accordingly.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.CalcMode.Spline
member.summary: The animation uses cubic BÃ©zier splines to interpolate values.
member.remarks: In 'spline' mode, the animation's pacing and smoothness can be finely controlled using BÃ©zier curves, allowing for more complex and nuanced transitions.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ChannelSelector
member.summary: Specifies the channel selectors for use in SVG filter operations.
member.remarks: Channel selectors are used in various SVG filter primitives to target specific color channels (Red, Green, Blue) or the alpha channel of an image. This allows for precise manipulation of these channels during filter processing.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ChannelSelector.R
member.summary: Selects the Red channel of the image.
member.remarks: The 'R' selector targets the red component of the color in an image, enabling operations that specifically affect the red channel.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ChannelSelector.G
member.summary: Selects the Green channel of the image.
member.remarks: The 'G' selector targets the green component of the color in an image, enabling operations that specifically affect the green channel.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ChannelSelector.B
member.summary: Selects the Blue channel of the image.
member.remarks: The 'B' selector targets the blue component of the color in an image, enabling operations that specifically affect the blue channel.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ChannelSelector.A
member.summary: Selects the Alpha (transparency) channel of the image.
member.remarks: The 'A' selector targets the alpha channel, which represents the transparency level of the image, allowing for manipulation of opacity and transparency effects.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ClipRule
member.summary: Defines the rule to determine how to clip paths in SVG graphics.
member.remarks: The clip rule property in SVG determines how paths are clipped. It is particularly important when a path intersects with itself or when multiple paths are combined. The rule helps in deciding which parts of the path are "inside" and should be filled (or visible) and which are "outside" and should be clipped (or invisible).

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ClipRule.Nonzero
member.summary: The nonzero winding rule for clipping paths.
member.remarks: Under the nonzero rule, a point is considered inside if a line drawn from that point to infinity crosses an odd number of path segments. This rule is useful for more complex shapes where path segments overlap.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ClipRule.Evenodd
member.summary: The even-odd winding rule for clipping paths.
member.remarks: Under the even-odd rule, a point is inside if a line from that point to infinity crosses an even number of path segments. This rule is simpler and can be more intuitive for basic shapes or non-overlapping paths.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ColorInterpolation
member.summary: Specifies the color interpolation mode for SVG elements and filters.
member.remarks: Color interpolation in SVG affects how colors are calculated and blended in both graphical elements and filter effects. Different modes can significantly impact the appearance of color transitions, gradients, and overall color rendering. This setting is crucial for achieving the desired visual outcome in SVG graphics.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ColorInterpolation.Auto
member.summary: Automatically determines the color interpolation mode.
member.remarks: When set to 'auto', the SVG renderer chooses the most suitable color interpolation mode based on the context, whether it's for graphical elements or filter effects. This option offers a balance between performance and color accuracy.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ColorInterpolation.SRGB
member.summary: Uses the standard RGB color space (sRGB) for color interpolation.
member.remarks: The sRGB mode interpolates colors in the standard RGB color space. It's widely used and ensures consistent color appearance across different devices and platforms. This mode is suitable for most general purposes in both graphical elements and filter effects.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ColorInterpolation.LinearRGB
member.summary: Uses a linear RGB color space for color interpolation.
member.remarks: Linear RGB mode provides a more physically accurate color interpolation by linearizing the RGB values. This mode is preferable for precise color transitions and is particularly effective in complex filter effects and high-quality graphics rendering, though it may be more computationally intensive.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ColorMatrixOperation
member.summary: Specifies the type of operation to be applied in a color matrix filter.
member.remarks: The color matrix filter in SVG allows for various operations on the color data of an image. Each operation type manipulates the colors in a specific way, offering a range of visual effects.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ColorMatrixOperation.Matrix
member.summary: Applies a matrix transformation to the color data.
member.remarks: The 'matrix' operation uses a 5x4 matrix to transform the RGBA color values of each pixel. This operation is highly versatile and can be used for complex color manipulations, including adjustments in brightness, contrast, and color balance.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ColorMatrixOperation.Saturate
member.summary: Adjusts the saturation level of the image.
member.remarks: The 'saturate' operation modifies the saturation of colors in the image. A value of 0% is completely un-saturated (grayscale), while 100% represents no change to the image's colors.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ColorMatrixOperation.HueRotate
member.summary: Applies a hue rotation on the image.
member.remarks: The 'hueRotate' operation rotates the hue of each pixel's color by a specified angle around the color wheel, allowing for dynamic color adjustments and effects.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ColorMatrixOperation.LuminanceToAlpha
member.summary: Converts the colors of the image to grayscale based on their luminance.
member.remarks: The 'luminanceToAlpha' operation creates a grayscale image based on the luminance (brightness) of each color, which can then be used for various masking and compositing operations.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ColorRendering
member.summary: Specifies the color rendering mode for an SVG element.
member.remarks: This property determines how colors are rendered, especially when dealing with color gradients, patterns, and image rendering. Different modes can affect the performance and quality of the color rendering process.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ColorRendering.Auto
member.summary: Allows the browser or viewer to choose the color rendering mode, balancing between speed and quality.
member.remarks: This is the default mode where the rendering engine decides the best way to render colors, typically aiming for a balance between performance and visual fidelity.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ColorRendering.OptimizeSpeed
member.summary: Prioritizes rendering speed over color precision and visual quality.
member.remarks: This mode is optimized for performance. It may be useful in scenarios where speed is more critical than color accuracy, such as for animations or interactive content.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ColorRendering.OptimizeQuality
member.summary: Prioritizes color accuracy and visual quality over rendering speed.
member.remarks: This mode is optimized for the best visual quality, particularly for static images where rendering speed is less of a concern. It ensures that colors are rendered as accurately as possible.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ComponentTransferType
member.summary: Specifies the type of component transfer function to be applied in the FeComponentTransfer filter primitive of an SVG.
member.remarks: The FeComponentTransfer filter primitive allows for individual manipulation of color components (RGB and alpha) of graphics elements using different types of transfer functions. Each type defines a distinct method of computation for color component transformation within the filter.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ComponentTransferType.Identity
member.summary: Represents no change in the input graphic. This is the default type.
member.remarks: The identity function leaves the input unchanged within the FeComponentTransfer filter. It is useful when no transformation is desired for a specific color component.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ComponentTransferType.Table
member.summary: Uses a lookup table to define the function within the filter.
member.remarks: The table function in FeComponentTransfer maps input values to output values based on a predefined set of values, allowing for complex, non-linear transformations of color components.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ComponentTransferType.Discrete
member.summary: Uses a set of discrete values to define the function in the filter.
member.remarks: The discrete function within FeComponentTransfer maps input values to a set of fixed output values, creating a step function for color component transformation.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ComponentTransferType.Linear
member.summary: Defines a linear transformation of the component within the filter.
member.remarks: The linear function in FeComponentTransfer applies a straightforward linear transformation to the input values, suitable for basic adjustments like brightness or contrast in color components.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ComponentTransferType.Gamma
member.summary: Defines a gamma correction transformation in the filter.
member.remarks: The gamma function in FeComponentTransfer applies a gamma correction to the input values, effectively adjusting the midtones of an image without significantly altering the shadows and highlights.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.CompositeOperator
member.summary: Specifies the type of compositing operation to be applied in SVG compositing operations.
member.remarks: Compositing operations in SVG determine how two graphic elements are combined into a single image. Each operator defines a distinct method of blending or combining these elements.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.CompositeOperator.Over
member.summary: Places the source graphic over the destination graphic.
member.remarks: The 'over' operator draws the source on top of the destination. It is the default compositing operation and is used when no other operator is specified.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.CompositeOperator.In
member.summary: Displays the source graphic where it overlaps the destination graphic.
member.remarks: The 'in' operator shows the source only where it overlaps the destination. The non-overlapping parts of the source are made transparent.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.CompositeOperator.Out
member.summary: Displays the source graphic where it does not overlap the destination.
member.remarks: The 'out' operator shows the source graphic only where it does not overlap the destination. The overlapping parts of the source are made transparent.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.CompositeOperator.Atop
member.summary: Displays the source graphic atop the destination graphic.
member.remarks: The 'atop' operator displays the source graphic on top of the destination, but only in the areas where the destination exists.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.CompositeOperator.Xor
member.summary: Displays the source graphic where it does not overlap the destination and vice versa.
member.remarks: The 'xor' operator shows the source graphic where it does not overlap the destination and the destination where it does not overlap the source.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.CompositeOperator.Arithmetic
member.summary: Allows for a custom arithmetic compositing operation.
member.remarks: The 'arithmetic' operator enables custom compositing effects using arithmetic expressions. This provides more control over how the source and destination graphics are combined.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.CompositingOperator
member.summary: Specifies the type of compositing operation to be applied in SVG masking operations.
member.remarks: Compositing operators in SVG masks determine how different graphic elements are combined to create a mask effect. Each operator defines a unique method of blending or combining these elements to achieve various masking effects.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.CompositingOperator.Add
member.summary: Adds the color values of the source graphic to the destination graphic.
member.remarks: The 'add' operator combines the source and destination graphics by adding their color values. This can result in brighter colors where the graphics overlap.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.CompositingOperator.Subtract
member.summary: Subtracts the color values of the source graphic from the destination graphic.
member.remarks: The 'subtract' operator creates a masking effect by subtracting the color values of the source graphic from those of the destination. This can produce darker areas where the graphics overlap.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.CompositingOperator.Intersect
member.summary: Displays only the areas where both the source and destination graphics overlap.
member.remarks: The 'intersect' operator shows only the parts of the graphics that overlap each other. Non-overlapping areas of both the source and destination are made transparent.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.CompositingOperator.Exclude
member.summary: Excludes the overlapping areas of the source and destination graphics.
member.remarks: The 'exclude' operator displays the source and destination graphics, but makes the overlapping areas transparent, effectively excluding them from the mask.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.CoordinateUnits
member.summary: Specifies the coordinate system units for various SVG elements such as masks, paint servers, and filters.
member.remarks: The coordinate units determine how values are interpreted in different SVG contexts. They can be set to either use the user space coordinates or be relative to the bounding box of the object.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.CoordinateUnits.UserSpaceOnUse
member.summary: Uses the user coordinate system for the SVG element.
member.remarks: When set to 'userSpaceOnUse', coordinates and lengths are interpreted in the current user coordinate system. This is useful when you want to apply effects or transformations relative to the overall SVG canvas.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.CoordinateUnits.ObjectBoundingBox
member.summary: Uses the bounding box of the object for the SVG element.
member.remarks: When set to 'objectBoundingBox', coordinates and lengths are interpreted relative to the bounding box of the object. This allows for effects or transformations that scale automatically with the size of the object.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor
member.summary: Defines cursor types for SVG elements, allowing customization of the cursor appearance when hovering over these elements.
member.remarks: This enumeration provides a range of cursor styles that can be applied to SVG elements. These styles help indicate the type of interaction available or the status of the element under the cursor.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.Auto
member.summary: The browser determines the cursor to display based on the current context.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.Default
member.summary: Default cursor, typically an arrow.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.None
member.summary: No cursor is displayed.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.ContextMenu
member.summary: Cursor indicating a context menu is available.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.Help
member.summary: Cursor indicating help information is available.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.Pointer
member.summary: Cursor indicating a clickable element, typically a hand pointer.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.Progress
member.summary: Cursor indicating an ongoing operation or task.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.Wait
member.summary: Cursor indicating that the system is busy and the user should wait.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.Cell
member.summary: Cursor indicating a cell or table element.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.Crosshair
member.summary: Cursor indicating precision selection, typically a crosshair.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.Text
member.summary: Cursor indicating text selection.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.VerticalText
member.summary: Cursor indicating vertical text selection.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.Alias
member.summary: Cursor indicating an alias or shortcut is being created.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.Copy
member.summary: Cursor indicating copy operation.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.Move
member.summary: Cursor indicating a movable item or area.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.NoDrop
member.summary: Cursor indicating that dropping is not allowed.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.NotAllowed
member.summary: Cursor indicating an action is not allowed.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.Grab
member.summary: Cursor indicating an item can be grabbed.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.Grabbing
member.summary: Cursor indicating an item is currently being grabbed.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.EResize
member.summary: Cursor indicating eastward resize.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.NResize
member.summary: Cursor indicating northward resize.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.NEResize
member.summary: Cursor indicating northeastward resize.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.NWResize
member.summary: Cursor indicating northwestward resize.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.SResize
member.summary: Cursor indicating southward resize.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.SEResize
member.summary: Cursor indicating southeastward resize.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.SWResize
member.summary: Cursor indicating southwestward resize.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.WResize
member.summary: Cursor indicating westward resize.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.EWResize
member.summary: Cursor indicating east-west resize.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.NSResize
member.summary: Cursor indicating north-south resize.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.NESWResize
member.summary: Cursor indicating northeast-southwest resize.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.NWSeResize
member.summary: Cursor indicating northwest-southeast resize.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.ColResize
member.summary: Cursor indicating column resize.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.RowResize
member.summary: Cursor indicating row resize.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.AllScroll
member.summary: Cursor indicating scrolling in all directions.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.ZoomIn
member.summary: Cursor indicating zoom-in capability.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Cursor.ZoomOut
member.summary: Cursor indicating zoom-out capability.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Dash
member.summary: Defines the pattern of dashes and gaps used to paint the outline of shapes (stroke) in SVG elements.
member.remarks: The 'stroke-dasharray' attribute in SVG is used to create dashed lines by specifying the pattern of dashes and gaps. This enumeration provides options for setting this pattern.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Dash.None
member.summary: Indicates a solid stroke with no dashes. This is the default behavior when 'stroke-dasharray' is not specified.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DisplayType
member.summary: Specifies the display behavior of elements in SVG documents.
member.remarks: The 'display' property in SVG and CSS determines how an element is displayed in the document layout. This enumeration provides various options for setting the display type, influencing how elements are rendered and interact with the layout.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DisplayType.Inline
member.summary: The element generates one or more inline boxes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DisplayType.Block
member.summary: The element generates a block box.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DisplayType.ListItem
member.summary: The element generates a block box for the content and a separate list-item inline box.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DisplayType.InlineBlock
member.summary: The element generates a block box for the content and an inline box for the container.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DisplayType.Table
member.summary: The element behaves like a table element.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DisplayType.InlineTable
member.summary: The element behaves like an inline table.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DisplayType.TableRowGroup
member.summary: The element behaves like a table row group.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DisplayType.TableHeaderGroup
member.summary: The element behaves like a table header group.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DisplayType.TableFooterGroup
member.summary: The element behaves like a table footer group.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DisplayType.TableRow
member.summary: The element behaves like a table row.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DisplayType.TableColumnGroup
member.summary: The element behaves like a table column group.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DisplayType.TableColumn
member.summary: The element behaves like a table column.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DisplayType.TableCell
member.summary: The element behaves like a table cell.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DisplayType.TableCaption
member.summary: The element behaves like a table caption.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DisplayType.None
member.summary: The element does not generate any box and is not rendered. It does not affect layout.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DisplayType.Flex
member.summary: The element behaves like a flex container.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DisplayType.InlineFlex
member.summary: The element behaves like an inline flex container.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DisplayType.Grid
member.summary: The element behaves like a grid container.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DisplayType.InlineGrid
member.summary: The element behaves like an inline grid container.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DominantBaseline
member.summary: Specifies the dominant baseline used for aligning text.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DominantBaseline.Auto
member.summary: Automatically determines the dominant baseline based on the font and/or the language.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DominantBaseline.TextBottom
member.summary: Aligns the text to the bottom of the em square.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DominantBaseline.Alphabetic
member.summary: Aligns the text on the baseline used by alphabetic characters.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DominantBaseline.Ideographic
member.summary: Aligns the text on the baseline used by ideographic characters.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DominantBaseline.Middle
member.summary: Aligns the text in the middle of the em square.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DominantBaseline.Central
member.summary: Aligns the text in the central baseline of the em square.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DominantBaseline.Mathematical
member.summary: Aligns the text on the baseline used by mathematical characters.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DominantBaseline.Hanging
member.summary: Aligns the text on the hanging baseline, typically used for Tibetan or other Asian scripts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.DominantBaseline.TextTop
member.summary: Aligns the text to the top of the em square.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Dur
member.summary: Specifies the duration of an animation in SVG.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Dur.Media
member.summary: The duration of the animation is determined by the length of the media being used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Dur.Indefinite
member.summary: The animation will continue indefinitely until it is explicitly stopped.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.EdgeMode
member.summary: Specifies the edge mode for the feConvolveMatrix filter primitive in SVG.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.EdgeMode.Duplicate
member.summary: The input image is extended along each of its borders as necessary by duplicating the color values at the given edge of the input image.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.EdgeMode.Wrap
member.summary: The input image is conceptually wrapped (or tiled) and the convolution uses these wrapped values. This creates a toroidal topology for the image.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.EdgeMode.None
member.summary: The edge mode is not defined, and the effect of the filter is defined by the implementation.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FillRule
member.summary: Specifies the rule to determine what parts of a shape are inside or outside in SVG graphics.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FillRule.Nonzero
member.summary: The nonzero winding rule: Determines the "insideness" of a point in the shape by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and counting the number of path segments from the given shape that the ray crosses. If this number is odd, the point is inside; if even, the point is outside.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FillRule.Evenodd
member.summary: The even-odd winding rule: Determines the "insideness" of a point in the shape by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and counting the number of path segments from the given shape that the ray crosses. If this number is even, the point is outside; if odd, the point is inside.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FilterInput
member.summary: Specifies predefined input images for an SVG filter.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FilterInput.SourceGraphic
member.summary: Refers to the graphic element to which the filter is applied.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FilterInput.SourceAlpha
member.summary: Refers to the alpha channel of the graphic element to which the filter is applied.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FilterInput.BackgroundImage
member.summary: Refers to the background image that lies directly beneath the graphic element to which the filter is applied.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FilterInput.BackgroundAlpha
member.summary: Refers to the alpha channel of the background image that lies directly beneath the graphic element to which the filter is applied.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FilterInput.FillPaint
member.summary: Refers to the fill paint of the graphic element to which the filter is applied.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FilterInput.StrokePaint
member.summary: Refers to the stroke paint of the graphic element to which the filter is applied.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontSize
member.summary: Specifies predefined font sizes for SVG text elements.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontSize.XXSmall
member.summary: Represents an extra-extra-small font size.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontSize.XSmall
member.summary: Represents an extra-small font size.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontSize.Small
member.summary: Represents a small font size.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontSize.Medium
member.summary: Represents a medium font size.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontSize.Large
member.summary: Represents a large font size.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontSize.XLarge
member.summary: Represents an extra-large font size.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontSize.XXLarge
member.summary: Represents an extra-extra-large font size.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontSize.Larger
member.summary: Represents a font size larger than the parent element's font size.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontSize.Smaller
member.summary: Represents a font size smaller than the parent element's font size.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontSize.Inherit
member.summary: Inherits the font size from the parent element.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontStretch
member.summary: Specifies the different levels of font stretching for SVG text elements.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontStretch.Normal
member.summary: Represents the normal (default) font stretch.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontStretch.UltraCondensed
member.summary: Represents the most condensed font stretch.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontStretch.ExtraCondensed
member.summary: Represents a more condensed font stretch than 'condensed' but less than 'ultra-condensed'.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontStretch.Condensed
member.summary: Represents a condensed font stretch.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontStretch.SemiCondensed
member.summary: Represents a slightly condensed font stretch.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontStretch.SemiExpanded
member.summary: Represents a slightly expanded font stretch.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontStretch.Expanded
member.summary: Represents an expanded font stretch.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontStretch.ExtraExpanded
member.summary: Represents a more expanded font stretch than 'expanded' but less than 'ultra-expanded'.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontStretch.UltraExpanded
member.summary: Represents the most expanded font stretch.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontStyle
member.summary: Specifies the different styles of fonts for SVG text elements.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontStyle.Normal
member.summary: Represents the normal font style, with no emphasis or slant.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontStyle.Italic
member.summary: Represents a font style with an italicized appearance, typically used for emphasis.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontStyle.Oblique
member.summary: Represents a font style with an oblique appearance, similar to italic but with a less pronounced slant.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontWeight
member.summary: Specifies the different weights of fonts for SVG text elements.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontWeight.Normal
member.summary: Represents the normal font weight, which is the default weight.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontWeight.Bold
member.summary: Represents a bold font weight, typically used for emphasis.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontWeight.Bolder
member.summary: Represents a font weight that is bolder than the parent element's weight.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontWeight.Lighter
member.summary: Represents a font weight that is lighter than the parent element's weight.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontWeight.W100
member.summary: Represents the font weight of 100, the thinnest available.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontWeight.W200
member.summary: Represents the font weight of 200.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontWeight.W300
member.summary: Represents the font weight of 300.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontWeight.W400
member.summary: Represents the font weight of 400, equivalent to 'normal'.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontWeight.W500
member.summary: Represents the font weight of 500.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontWeight.W600
member.summary: Represents the font weight of 600.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontWeight.W700
member.summary: Represents the font weight of 700, equivalent to 'bold'.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontWeight.W800
member.summary: Represents the font weight of 800.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.FontWeight.W900
member.summary: Represents the font weight of 900, the boldest available.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.GeometryBox
member.summary: Specifies the reference box for mask and clip-path elements in SVG.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.GeometryBox.MarginBox
member.summary: Uses the margin box as the reference box.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.GeometryBox.BorderBox
member.summary: Uses the border box as the reference box.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.GeometryBox.PaddingBox
member.summary: Uses the padding box as the reference box.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.GeometryBox.ContentBox
member.summary: Uses the content box as the reference box.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.GeometryBox.FillBox
member.summary: Uses the area of the element's fill as the reference box.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.GeometryBox.StrokeBox
member.summary: Uses the area of the element's stroke as the reference box.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.GeometryBox.ViewBox
member.summary: Uses the nearest SVG viewport as the reference box.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.HorizontalEdge
member.summary: Specifies the horizontal edge reference for positioning in SVG.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.HorizontalEdge.Left
member.summary: Refers to the left edge for horizontal positioning.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.HorizontalEdge.Right
member.summary: Refers to the right edge for horizontal positioning.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.HorizontalPosition
member.summary: Specifies the horizontal position of an element or a component in SVG.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.HorizontalPosition.Left
member.summary: Aligns the element or component to the left.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.HorizontalPosition.Center
member.summary: Centers the element or component horizontally.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.HorizontalPosition.Right
member.summary: Aligns the element or component to the right.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ImageRendering
member.summary: Specifies how an image should be rendered in SVG.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ImageRendering.Auto
member.summary: The browser makes a trade-off between speed and quality when rendering the image.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ImageRendering.OptimizeSpeed
member.summary: The browser emphasizes rendering speed over image quality. This often means scaling images in a way that might make them look pixelated or blocky.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ImageRendering.OptimizeQuality
member.summary: The browser emphasizes image quality over rendering speed. This can mean smoother, higher quality scaling of images but might result in slower rendering.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.IndefiniteRepeat
member.summary: Specifies the indefinite repetition of an SVG animation.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.IndefiniteRepeat.Indefinite
member.summary: Indicates that the animation should repeat indefinitely.
member.remarks: When used with the 'repeatDur' or 'repeatCount' attributes, this value specifies that the animation should continue to repeat for an unlimited number of times, or until the animation is explicitly stopped.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Kerning
member.summary: Specifies the kerning behavior for text in SVG.
member.remarks: The 'font-kerning' property in SVG controls the usage of the kerning information stored in a font. Kerning adjusts the space between individual letter pairs to improve visual appearance of text. This enum provides options for controlling kerning behavior in SVG text elements.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Kerning.Auto
member.summary: Enables the browser to determine whether kerning should be applied.
member.remarks: When set to 'auto', the browser decides on the kerning based on font and text characteristics. This is typically the default behavior.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Kerning.Normal
member.summary: Applies the standard kerning, as defined in the font file.
member.remarks: The 'normal' setting uses the kerning information included in the font by the font designer. This setting is often preferred for high-quality typography.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Kerning.None
member.summary: Disables kerning, ignoring any kerning information in the font.
member.remarks: When set to 'none', kerning is completely turned off. This may result in less visually appealing text spacing but can be useful in certain scenarios, like monospaced fonts.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.LengthAdjust
member.summary: Specifies how text length adjustments are made in SVG.
member.remarks: The 'lengthAdjust' attribute in SVG text elements controls how text scaling is applied when the text must fit into a specified length.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.LengthAdjust.Spacing
member.summary: Adjusts the spacing between characters to achieve the desired length.
member.remarks: When set to 'spacing', the adjustment is made by modifying the space between characters. The glyphs themselves are not stretched or compressed.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.LengthAdjust.SpacingAndGlyphs
member.summary: Adjusts both the spacing and the size of the glyphs to achieve the desired length.
member.remarks: When set to 'spacingAndGlyphs', the adjustment is made by altering both the spacing between characters and the size of the glyphs. This can lead to stretched or compressed text appearance.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.LengthType
member.summary: Specifies the units of measurement for lengths in SVG.
member.remarks: This enumeration defines various units that can be used to specify lengths in SVG elements. These units include absolute measurements like pixels and centimeters, as well as relative measurements like percentages and ems.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.LengthType.Number
member.summary: Represents a numeric value without any unit. It is often interpreted in the context of other values or default units.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.LengthType.Percentage
member.summary: Represents a percentage value, relative to another value or a bounding dimension.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.LengthType.Ems
member.summary: Represents a length in 'ems', a scalable unit that is relative to the current font size.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.LengthType.Exs
member.summary: Represents a length in 'exs', related to the x-height of the current font.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.LengthType.Px
member.summary: Represents a length in pixels, a unit of measurement based on the digital representation of an image.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.LengthType.Cm
member.summary: Represents a length in centimeters.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.LengthType.Mm
member.summary: Represents a length in millimeters.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.LengthType.In
member.summary: Represents a length in inches.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.LengthType.Pt
member.summary: Represents a length in points, a traditional unit in typography. 1 point is approximately 1/72 of an inch.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.LengthType.Pc
member.summary: Represents a length in picas, a typographic unit of measurement. 1 pica is equivalent to 12 points.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.MarkerPos
member.summary: Specifies the position of markers in SVG.
member.remarks: This enumeration is used to define the presence or absence of markers in an SVG element. It is typically used in attributes that control the rendering of markers at the vertices or control points of shapes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.MarkerPos.None
member.summary: Indicates that no markers will be rendered on the element.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.MarkerUnits
member.summary: Specifies the coordinate system for the marker size in SVG.
member.remarks: This enumeration defines the coordinate system used to calculate the size of markers in SVG. It determines whether the marker size is relative to the stroke width or based on the user coordinate system.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.MarkerUnits.StrokeWidth
member.summary: The size of the marker is relative to the stroke width of the path.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.MarkerUnits.UserSpaceOnUse
member.summary: The size of the marker is based on the user coordinate system, making it independent of the stroke width.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Media
member.summary: Specifies the media-related timing conditions for SVG animations.
member.remarks: This enumeration is used to define media-related timing conditions in SVG animations. It is particularly relevant for animations that are dependent on or synchronized with external media, such as audio or video.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Media.Media
member.summary: Indicates that the timing of the animation is dependent on the timing of the media.
member.remarks: When this value is used, the animation's timing is directly linked to the media's playback. For example, an animation might start, pause, or stop in synchronization with specific points in a video or audio track.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.MorphologyOperator
member.summary: Specifies the type of morphological operation to be applied in SVG filters.
member.remarks: This enumeration is used in the context of SVG filters to define the type of morphological operation. Morphological operations are used to process the shape and structure of elements in an image, typically for eroding or dilating the graphics.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.MorphologyOperator.Erode
member.summary: Erodes the graphics, making the shapes smaller and the edges smoother.
member.remarks: The 'erode' operation is used to contract the edges of shapes within an image. It is typically used to remove small imperfections or to simplify the overall structure of the graphics.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.MorphologyOperator.Dilate
member.summary: Dilates the graphics, making the shapes larger and the edges more pronounced.
member.remarks: The 'dilate' operation is used to expand the edges of shapes within an image. This can be used to emphasize certain features, create bold effects, or prepare the image for further processing.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Orient
member.summary: Specifies the orientation of the marker relative to the shape it is attached to.
member.remarks: The 'orient' attribute in SVG markers determines how the marker is oriented when it is placed at its position on the shape. This enum provides options for setting the orientation behavior of markers.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Orient.Auto
member.summary: The marker is oriented in such a way that it points in the direction of the path.
member.remarks: When set to 'auto', the marker adjusts its orientation automatically based on the direction of the path at the point where it is attached.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Orient.AutoStartReverse
member.summary: The marker is oriented in the reverse direction of the path's start.
member.remarks: When set to 'auto-start-reverse', the marker is oriented in the reverse direction at the start of the path, providing a mirrored orientation compared to 'auto'.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Overflow
member.summary: Specifies the overflow behavior for SVG elements.
member.remarks: This enumeration controls how content that exceeds the bounds of an SVG element is displayed. It determines whether the excess content is visible, clipped, or provided with scrollbars.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Overflow.Visible
member.summary: Content that exceeds the bounds of the element is visible.
member.remarks: The 'visible' value allows content to overflow the element's box and be visible outside its bounds. This is useful when the overflow is intentional and should be displayed.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Overflow.Hidden
member.summary: Content that exceeds the bounds of the element is clipped and not visible.
member.remarks: The 'hidden' value causes any content that overflows the element's box to be clipped and not displayed. This is useful for maintaining strict boundaries for the element's content.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Overflow.Scroll
member.summary: Provides scrollbars for the content that exceeds the bounds of the element.
member.remarks: The 'scroll' value adds scrollbars to the element, allowing the user to scroll to see the overflow content. This is useful when the content is too large to fit within the element's bounds but should still be accessible to the user.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Paint
member.summary: Specifies the paint options for the fill and stroke attributes in SVG elements.
member.remarks: This enumeration defines the types of paint that can be applied to the fill and stroke properties of SVG elements. It allows for standard color, context-based fills, and strokes, or no paint at all.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Paint.None
member.summary: Indicates no paint should be applied.
member.remarks: The 'none' value is used to specify that no fill or stroke should be applied to the element. This is useful for creating transparent or empty areas within SVG graphics.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Paint.ContextFill
member.summary: Uses the current context fill color for painting.
member.remarks: The 'context-fill' value allows the element to use the current context's fill color. This is useful for ensuring consistency in color theming across different elements within the same SVG context.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Paint.ContextStroke
member.summary: Uses the current context stroke color for painting.
member.remarks: The 'context-stroke' value enables the element to use the current context's stroke color. This is beneficial for maintaining a uniform stroke appearance across various elements within the same SVG context.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PaintOrder
member.summary: Specifies the order in which fill, stroke, and markers are applied to SVG elements.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PaintOrder.Normal
member.summary: The default paint order: first fill, then stroke, and finally markers.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PaintOrder.Fill
member.summary: Paint only the fill.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PaintOrder.Stroke
member.summary: Paint only the stroke.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PaintOrder.Markers
member.summary: Paint only the markers.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PaintOrder.FillStroke
member.summary: Paint in the order of fill, then stroke.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PaintOrder.FillMarkers
member.summary: Paint in the order of fill, then markers.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PaintOrder.StrokeFill
member.summary: Paint in the order of stroke, then fill.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PaintOrder.StrokeMarkers
member.summary: Paint in the order of stroke, then markers.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PaintOrder.MarkersFill
member.summary: Paint in the order of markers, then fill.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PaintOrder.MarkersStroke
member.summary: Paint in the order of markers, then stroke.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PaintOrder.FillStrokeMarkers
member.summary: Paint in the order of fill, then stroke, and finally markers.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PaintOrder.FillMarkersStroke
member.summary: Paint in the order of fill, then markers, and finally stroke.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PaintOrder.StrokeFillMarkers
member.summary: Paint in the order of stroke, then fill, and finally markers.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PaintOrder.StrokeMarkersFill
member.summary: Paint in the order of stroke, then markers, and finally fill.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PaintOrder.MarkersFillStroke
member.summary: Paint in the order of markers, then fill, and finally stroke.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PaintOrder.MarkersStrokeFill
member.summary: Paint in the order of markers, then stroke, and finally fill.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PointerEvents
member.summary: Specifies how pointer events are handled by graphical elements in SVG.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PointerEvents.BoundingBox
member.summary: Pointer events are targeted at the bounding box of the element.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PointerEvents.VisiblePainted
member.summary: Pointer events are targeted only at the visible (painted) parts of the element.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PointerEvents.VisibleFill
member.summary: Pointer events are targeted only at the visible (filled) parts of the element.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PointerEvents.VisibleStroke
member.summary: Pointer events are targeted only at the visible (stroked) parts of the element.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PointerEvents.Visible
member.summary: Pointer events are targeted at all visible parts of the element.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PointerEvents.Painted
member.summary: Pointer events are targeted at all painted parts of the element, including fill and stroke.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PointerEvents.Fill
member.summary: Pointer events are targeted only at the filled parts of the element.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PointerEvents.Stroke
member.summary: Pointer events are targeted only at the stroked parts of the element.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PointerEvents.All
member.summary: Pointer events are targeted at all parts of the element, regardless of visibility.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.PointerEvents.None
member.summary: The element does not become the target of pointer events.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ReferrerPolicy
member.summary: Specifies the referrer policy to be used when fetching resources.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ReferrerPolicy.None
member.summary: No referrer policy is set.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ReferrerPolicy.NoReferrer
member.summary: The Referer header will not be sent.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ReferrerPolicy.NoReferrerWhenDowngrade
member.summary: The Referer header will not be sent to origins with less security (HTTPS -> HTTP).

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ReferrerPolicy.SameOrigin
member.summary: The Referer header will be sent for same-origin requests only.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ReferrerPolicy.Origin
member.summary: Only the origin of the document will be sent as the Referer header.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ReferrerPolicy.StrictOrigin
member.summary: Only the origin of the document will be sent as the Referer header for secure contexts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ReferrerPolicy.OriginWhenCrossOrigin
member.summary: The full URL will be sent as the Referer header for same-origin requests, but only the origin for cross-origin requests.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ReferrerPolicy.StrictOriginWhenCrossOrigin
member.summary: Only the origin of the document will be sent as the Referer header for same-origin requests, but no header for cross-origin requests in insecure contexts.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ReferrerPolicy.UnsafeUrl
member.summary: The full URL, including the path and query string, will always be sent as the Referer header.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.RepeatStyle
member.summary: Specifies the repeat style for background images or patterns in SVG.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.RepeatStyle.RepeatX
member.summary: The image or pattern is repeated horizontally only.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.RepeatStyle.RepeatY
member.summary: The image or pattern is repeated vertically only.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.RepeatStyle.Repeat
member.summary: The image or pattern is repeated both horizontally and vertically.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.RepeatStyle.Space
member.summary: The image or pattern is repeated as much as possible without clipping, and the remaining space is distributed evenly between the images.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.RepeatStyle.Round
member.summary: The image or pattern is scaled so that it fits and is repeated without clipping, maintaining its aspect ratio.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.RepeatStyle.NoRepeat
member.summary: The image or pattern is not repeated, and only one copy of the image will be drawn.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Restart
member.summary: Specifies the restart behavior for SVG animations.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Restart.Always
member.summary: The animation can be restarted at any time, even if it is currently active.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Restart.WhenNotActive
member.summary: The animation can only be restarted when it is not currently active.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Restart.Never
member.summary: The animation cannot be restarted once it has started; it will run to completion.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Rotate
member.summary: Specifies the rotation behavior for elements during motion animation in SVG.
member.remarks: The 'rotate' attribute in SVG's 'animateMotion' element controls the rotation of an element along a motion path. This enum provides options for how the element should rotate as it follows the path.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Rotate.Auto
member.summary: Automatically rotates the element in the direction of the path.
member.remarks: When set to 'auto', the element's rotation is automatically adjusted to align with the direction of the path at each point. This is commonly used for smooth, natural motion along curved paths.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Rotate.AutoReverse
member.summary: Automatically rotates the element in the direction of the path and allows it to reverse.
member.remarks: 'auto-reverse' rotates the element similar to 'auto', but also allows the element to reverse its rotation direction at certain points of the path. This can create dynamic, visually interesting effects, especially in looping animations.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ShapeRendering
member.summary: Specifies the shape rendering mode for SVG elements.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ShapeRendering.Auto
member.summary: The browser makes trade-offs between speed, smoothness, and geometric precision when rendering shapes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ShapeRendering.OptimizeSpeed
member.summary: The browser emphasizes rendering speed over geometric precision and smoothness. This mode can lead to faster rendering but less accurate shapes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ShapeRendering.CrispEdges
member.summary: The browser attempts to preserve sharp edges and corners. This mode is useful for rendering graphics with straight lines and edges.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ShapeRendering.GeometricPrecision
member.summary: The browser emphasizes geometric precision in rendering at the cost of speed. This mode is suitable for high-quality rendering where precise geometry is important.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Spacing
member.summary: Specifies the spacing behavior for text elements in SVG.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Spacing.Normal
member.summary: Indicates the use of the normal spacing behavior. The spacing is determined based on the current font and text size.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.SpreadMethod
member.summary: Specifies how the colors in a gradient are spread beyond its bounds.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.SpreadMethod.Pad
member.summary: The color of the last gradient stop is used to fill the rest of the gradient area.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.SpreadMethod.Reflect
member.summary: The gradient is reflected (mirrored) outside its bounds.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.SpreadMethod.Repeat
member.summary: The gradient is repeated outside its bounds.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.StitchTiles
member.summary: Specifies the stitching options for the 'feTurbulence' filter primitive.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.StitchTiles.Stitch
member.summary: The tiles are stitched together to form a smooth, continuous pattern.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.StitchTiles.NoStitch
member.summary: The tiles are not stitched, which may result in visible seams.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.StopUnitType
member.summary: Defines the unit types for the offset in gradient 'stop' elements.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.StopUnitType.Number
member.summary: The offset is defined as a number.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.StopUnitType.Percentage
member.summary: The offset is defined as a percentage of the gradient's size.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.StrokeLineCap
member.summary: Specifies the shape to be used at the end of open subpaths when they are stroked.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.StrokeLineCap.Butt
member.summary: The stroke ends with a flat edge perpendicular to the direction of the line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.StrokeLineCap.Round
member.summary: The stroke ends with a half-circle, which has a radius equal to the stroke width and is centered on the end of the line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.StrokeLineCap.Square
member.summary: The stroke ends with a square edge that extends half the stroke width beyond the end of the line.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.StrokeLineJoin
member.summary: Specifies the shape to be used at the corners of paths or basic shapes when they are stroked.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.StrokeLineJoin.Miter
member.summary: A sharp corner is used to join path segments.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.StrokeLineJoin.MiterClip
member.summary: Similar to 'miter', but if the join would extend beyond a limit, it is clipped.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.StrokeLineJoin.Round
member.summary: A rounded corner is used to join path segments.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.StrokeLineJoin.Bevel
member.summary: A beveled corner is used to join path segments.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.StrokeLineJoin.Arcs
member.summary: The corner is joined by arcs.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Target
member.summary: Specifies the browsing context for where to display the linked URL.

member.summary: Opens the linked document in the same frame as it was clicked.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Target.Parent
member.summary: Opens the linked document in the parent frame.

member.summary: Opens the linked document in the full body of the window.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.Target.Blank
member.summary: Opens the linked document in a new window or tab.

member.summary: The text is stretched to fit the path.

member.summary: Specifies the text rendering strategy in SVG.

member.summary: Emphasizes legibility over rendering speed and geometric precision.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.TextRendering.GeometricPrecision
member.summary: Emphasizes geometric precision over rendering speed and legibility.

member.summary: Refers to the top edge for vertical positioning.

member.summary: Aligns the element or component to the top.

member.summary: Specifies how white space inside an SVG element is handled.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.WhiteSpace.Normal
member.summary: White space is collapsed; newline characters create new lines.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.WhiteSpace.Pre
member.summary: White space is preserved; text is only wrapped where it contains newline characters.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.WhiteSpace.NoWrap
member.summary: White space is collapsed; text does not wrap.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.WhiteSpace.PreWrap
member.summary: White space is preserved; text wraps where necessary and on newline characters.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.WhiteSpace.BreakSpaces
member.summary: White space is preserved; line breaks are added to fill line boxes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.WhiteSpace.PreLine

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.WritingMode.HorizontalTb
member.summary: Horizontal text flow from top to bottom.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.WritingMode.VerticalRl
member.summary: Vertical text flow from right to left.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.WritingMode.VerticalLr
member.summary: Vertical text flow from left to right.

member.summary: Specifies the behavior when an SVG link is triggered.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.XLinkShow.New
member.summary: Opens the link in a new window or tab.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.XLinkShow.Replace
member.summary: Replaces the current SVG document with the linked document.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.XLinkShow.Embed
member.summary: Embeds the linked document within the current SVG document.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.XLinkShow.Other
member.summary: Specifies a behavior other than the predefined behaviors.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.XLinkShow.None
member.summary: Indicates that no specific behavior is requested.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.XmlSpace
member.summary: Specifies how white space inside elements is handled in XML documents.
member.remarks: The 'xml:space' attribute in XML is used to control whether white space inside elements should be preserved or normalized. This enumeration provides options for setting this behavior in XML and SVG documents.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.XmlSpace.Default
member.summary: Indicates that white space should be handled according to the XML processor's default behavior, typically normalizing white space by removing line breaks and extra spaces.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.XmlSpace.Preserve
member.summary: Indicates that white space should be preserved as it appears in the XML document. This is useful for maintaining the formatting of text where white space is significant.

member.summary: Disables both zooming and panning features.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Builder.ZoomAndPan.Magnify
member.summary: Enables zooming and panning features.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Builder.SVGBuilderExtensions.OnFocusIn``1(``0,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the 'onfocusin' event attribute for handling focus-in events on the element.
member.param: The SVG element builder.
The JavaScript function or script to execute when the element receives focus, typically before the 'onfocus' event.
member.remarks: The 'onfocusin' event is triggered when an element is about to receive focus. This event differs from 'onfocus' in that it supports bubbling and can be used to detect focus changes on child elements as well.
member.typeparam: The type of the SVG element builder.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Builder.SVGBuilderExtensions.OnFocusOut``1(``0,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the 'onfocusout' event attribute for handling focus-out events on the element.
member.param: The SVG element builder.
The JavaScript function or script to execute when the element loses focus, typically before the 'onblur' event.
member.remarks: The 'onfocusout' event is triggered when an element is about to lose focus. Similar to 'onfocusin', this event supports bubbling and can be used to detect focus changes on child elements as well.
member.typeparam: The type of the SVG element builder.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Builder.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The Aspose.Svg.Builder namespace contains classes and interfaces for building and manipulating SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics) documents using the Aspose.SVG library. This namespace provides a rich set of builder classes that simplify the creation and modification of SVG elements and their attributes. These builders offer a fluent API, making the code more readable and maintainable.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Converters.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The Aspose.Svg.Converters namespace goal is easy access to conversion methods. It provides a wide range of conversions to the popular formats, such as PDF, XPS, image formats, etc. More specific conversion (rendering, saving) user cases are presented by well known and documented low level API functions in subject oriented namespaces.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.Counter
member.summary: The Counter interface is used to represent any counter or counters function value. This interface reflects the values in the underlying style property.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.Counter.Identifier
member.summary: This attribute is used for the identifier of the counter.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.Counter.ListStyle
member.summary: This attribute is used for the style of the list.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.Counter.Separator
member.summary: This attribute is used for the separator of the nested counters.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.CSSPrimitiveValue
member.summary: The CSSPrimitiveValue interface represents a single CSS value. This interface may be used to determine the value of a specific style property currently set in a block or to set a specific style property explicitly within the block. An instance of this interface might be obtained from the getPropertyCSSValue method of the CSSStyleDeclaration interface. A CSSPrimitiveValue object only occurs in a context of a CSS property.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.CSSPrimitiveValue.CSS_UNKNOWN
member.summary: The value is not a recognized CSS2 value. The value can only be obtained by using the cssText attribute.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.CSSPrimitiveValue.CSS_NUMBER
member.summary: The value is a simple number. The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.CSSPrimitiveValue.CSS_PERCENTAGE
member.summary: The value is a percentage. The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.CSSPrimitiveValue.CSS_EMS
member.summary: The value is a length (ems). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.CSSPrimitiveValue.CSS_EXS
member.summary: The value is a length (exs). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.CSSPrimitiveValue.CSS_PX
member.summary: The value is a length (px). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.CSSPrimitiveValue.CSS_CM
member.summary: The value is a length (cm). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.CSSPrimitiveValue.CSS_MM
member.summary: The value is a length (mm). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.CSSPrimitiveValue.CSS_IN
member.summary: The value is a length (in). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.CSSPrimitiveValue.CSS_PT
member.summary: The value is a length (pt). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.CSSPrimitiveValue.CSS_PC
member.summary: The value is a length (pc). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.CSSPrimitiveValue.CSS_DEG
member.summary: The value is an angle (deg). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.CSSPrimitiveValue.CSS_RAD
member.summary: The value is an angle (rad). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.CSSPrimitiveValue.CSS_GRAD
member.summary: The value is an angle (grad). The value can be obtained by using the getFloatValue method.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.CSSPrimitiveValue.CSS_MS

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSCharsetRule
member.summary: The CSSCharsetRule interface represents a @charset rule in a CSS style sheet. The value of the encoding attribute does not affect the encoding of text data in the DOM objects; this encoding is always UTF-16. After a stylesheet is loaded, the value of the encoding attribute is the value found in the @charset rule. If there was no @charset in the original document, then no CSSCharsetRule is created. The value of the encoding attribute may also be used as a hint for the encoding used on serialization of the style sheet.
