member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Sandbox
member.summary: A sandboxing flag set is a set of zero or more of the following flags, which are used to restrict the abilities that potentially untrusted resources.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Sandbox.None
member.summary: No flag is set, every sandbox feature is accepted

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Sandbox.Navigation
member.summary: This flag prevents content from navigating browsing contexts other than the sandboxed browsing context itself (or browsing contexts further nested inside it), auxiliary browsing contexts (which are protected by the sandboxed auxiliary navigation browsing context flag defined next), and the top-level browsing context (which is protected by the sandboxed top-level navigation browsing context flag defined below). If the sandboxed auxiliary navigation browsing context flag is not set, then in certain cases the restrictions nonetheless allow popups (new top-level browsing contexts) to be opened. These browsing contexts always have one permitted sandboxed navigator, set when the browsing context is created, which allows the browsing context that created them to actually navigate them. (Otherwise, the sandboxed navigation browsing context flag would prevent them from being navigated even if they were opened.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Sandbox.AuxiliaryNavigation
member.summary: This flag prevents content from creating new auxiliary browsing contexts, e.g. using the target attribute, or the window.open() method.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Sandbox.TopLevelNavigation
member.summary: This flag prevents content from navigating their top-level browsing context and prevents content from closing their top-level browsing context. When the sandboxed top-level navigation browsing context flag is not set, content can navigate its top-level browsing context, but other browsing contexts are still protected by the sandboxed navigation browsing context flag and possibly the sandboxed auxiliary navigation browsing context flag.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Sandbox.Plugins
member.summary: This flag prevents content from instantiating plugins, whether using the embed element, the object element, the applet element, or through navigation of a nested browsing context, unless those plugins can be secured.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Sandbox.Origin
member.summary: This flag forces content into a unique origin, thus preventing it from accessing other content from the same origin.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Sandbox.Forms
member.summary: This flag blocks form submission.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Sandbox.PointerLock
member.summary: This flag disables the Pointer Lock API.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Sandbox.Scripts
member.summary: This flag blocks script execution.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Sandbox.AutomaticFeatures
member.summary: This flag blocks features that trigger automatically, such as automatically playing a video or automatically focusing a form control.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Sandbox.Fullscreen
member.summary: This flag prevents content from using the requestFullscreen() method.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Sandbox.DocumentDomain
member.summary: This flag prevents content from using the document.domain feature to change the effective script origin.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Sandbox.Images
member.summary: This flag disables image loading.

member.summary: Returns the Window object's browsing context's WindowProxy object.

member.summary: The document attribute must return the Window object's newest Document object.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Window.IWindow.Name
member.summary: The name attribute of the Window object must, on getting, return the current name of the browsing context, and, on setting, set the name of the browsing context to the new value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Window.IWindow.Location
member.summary: The location attribute of the Window interface must return the Location object for that Window object's Document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Window.IWindow.Top
member.summary: The top IDL attribute on the Window object of a Document in a browsing context b must return the WindowProxy object of its top-level browsing context (which would be its own WindowProxy object if it was a top-level browsing context itself), if it has one, or its own WindowProxy object otherwise (e.g. if it was a detached nested browsing context).

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Window.IWindow.Opener
member.summary: The opener IDL attribute on the Window object, on getting, must return the WindowProxy object of the browsing context from which the current browsing context was created (its opener browsing context), if there is one, if it is still available, and if the current browsing context has not disowned its opener; otherwise, it must return null. On setting, if the new value is null then the current browsing context must disown its opener; if the new value is anything else then the user agent must call the [[DefineOwnProperty]] internal method of the Window object, passing the property name "opener" as the property key, and the Property Descriptor { [[Value]]: value, [[Writable]]: true, [[Enumerable]]: true, [[Configurable]]: true } as the property descriptor, where value is the new value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Window.IWindow.Parent
member.summary: The parent IDL attribute on the Window object of a Document in a browsing context b must return the WindowProxy object of the parent browsing context, if there is one (i.e. if b is a child browsing context), or the WindowProxy object of the browsing context b itself, otherwise (i.e. if it is a top-level browsing context or a detached nested browsing context).

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.IO.IBlob.Size
member.summary: Returns the size of the byte sequence in number of bytes. On getting, conforming user agents must return the total number of bytes that can be read by a FileReader or FileReaderSync object, or 0 if the Blob has no bytes to be read.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.IO.IBlob.Type
member.summary: The ASCII-encoded string in lower case representing the media type of the Blob. On getting, user agents must return the type of a Blob as an ASCII-encoded string in lower case, such that when it is converted to a byte sequence, it is a parsable MIME type, or the empty string â€“ 0 bytes â€“ if the type cannot be determined.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.IO.OutputStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The output stream to be wrapped.
The URI of stream location.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.IO.OutputStream.Flush
member.summary: Clears all buffers for the wrapped output stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.IO.OutputStream.Close
member.summary: Closes the wrapped output stream and current stream.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.IO.OutputStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the wrapped output stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the the wrapped output stream.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the wrapped output stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the wrapped output stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.IO.OutputStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Sets the position within the wrapped output stream.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the origin parameter.
A value of type indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current stream.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.IO.OutputStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Sets the length of the wrapped output stream.
member.param: The desired length of the wrapped output stream in bytes.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.IO.OutputStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a sequence of bytes to the wrapped output stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies count bytes from buffer to the wrapped output stream.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin copying bytes to the wrapped output stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the wrapped output stream.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.IO.OutputStream.Uri
member.summary: Gets the URI of stream location.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.IDevice.ClosePath
member.summary: Closes the current subpath by appending a straight line segment from the current point to the starting point of the subpath. If the current subpath is already closed, "ClosePath" does nothing. This operator terminates the current subpath. Appending another segment to the current path begins a new subpath, even if the new segment begins at the endpoint reached by the "ClosePath" method.

member.summary: Appends a straight line segment from the current point to the point (pt). The new current point is pt.
member.param: Point of where to create the line to.

member.summary: Appends a rectangle to the current path as a complete subpath.

member.summary: Appends a cubic BÃ©zier curve to the current path. The curve extends from the current point to the point pt3, using pt1 and pt2 as the BÃ©zier control points. The new current point is pt3.
member.param: Coordinates of first point
Coordinates of second point
Coordinates of third point

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.IDevice.Stroke
member.summary: Strokes a line along the current path. The stroked line follows each straight or curved segment in the path, centered on the segment with sides parallel to it. Each of the pathâ€™s subpaths is treated separately. This method terminates current path.

member.summary: Fills the entire region enclosed by the current path. If the path consists of several disconnected subpaths, it fills the insides of all subpaths, considered together. This method terminates current path.

member.param: Filling mode specifies how the interior of a closed path is clipped

member.summary: The DOMTokenList class represents a set of space-separated tokens. It is indexed beginning with 0 as with JavaScript Array objects. DOMTokenList is always case-sensitive.

member.summary: Returns true if the list contains the given token, otherwise false.
member.param: The token to locate in the list.
member.returns: A Boolean, which is true if the calling list contains token, otherwise false.

member.summary: Adds the specified token(s) to the list.

member.summary: Removes the specified token(s) from the list.
member.param: Represents the token(s) you want to remove from the list.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Collections.DOMTokenList.Toggle(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the token from the list if it exists, or adds the token to the list if it doesn't.
member.param: The token you want to toggle.
member.returns: A Boolean indicating whether token is in the list after the call.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Collections.DOMTokenList.Toggle(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes the token from the list if it exists, or adds the token to the list if it doesn't.
member.param: The token you want to toggle.

A Boolean that, if included, turns the toggle into a one way-only operation. If set to false, then token will only be removed, but not added. If set to true, then token will only be added, but not removed.
member.returns: A Boolean indicating whether token is in the list after the call.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Collections.DOMTokenList.Replace(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Replaces an existing token with a new token. Does nothing if the first token doesn't exist.
member.param: The token you want to replace.
The token you want to replace the old token with.
member.returns: Boolean true if the token was found and replaced, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Collections.DOMTokenList.Supports(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if a given token is in the associated attribute's supported tokens.
member.param: The token to query for.
member.returns: A Boolean indicating whether the token was found.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Attr.TextContent
member.summary: This attribute returns the text content of this node and its descendants. When it is defined to be null, setting it has no effect. On setting, any possible children this node may have are removed and, if it the new string is not empty or null, replaced by a single Text node containing the string this attribute is set to.

member.summary: Returns the local part of the qualified name of this node. For nodes of any type other than ELEMENT_NODE and ATTRIBUTE_NODE and nodes created with a DOM Level 1 method, such as Document.createElement(), this is always null.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Document.CreateNodeIterator(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node)
member.summary: Create a new NodeIterator over the subtree rooted at the specified node.
member.param: node which will be iterated together with its children. The iterator is initially positioned just before this node. The whatToShow flags and the filter, if any, are not considered when setting this position. The root must not be null.
member.exception: NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: Raised if the specified root is null.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Document.CreateNodeIterator(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node,System.Int64)
member.summary: Create a new NodeIterator over the subtree rooted at the specified node.
member.param: node which will be iterated together with its children. The iterator is initially positioned just before this node. The whatToShow flags and the filter, if any, are not considered when setting this position. The root must not be null.

flag specifies which node types may appear in the logical view of the tree presented by the iterator. See the description of NodeFilter for the set of possible SHOW_ values.These flags can be combined using OR.
member.exception: NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: Raised if the specified root is null.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Document.CreateNodeIterator(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node,System.Int64,Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.INodeFilter)
member.summary: Create a new NodeIterator over the subtree rooted at the specified node.
member.param: node which will be iterated together with its children. The iterator is initially positioned just before this node. The whatToShow flags and the filter, if any, are not considered when setting this position. The root must not be null.

flag specifies which node types may appear in the logical view of the tree presented by the iterator. See the description of NodeFilter for the set of possible SHOW_ values.These flags can be combined using OR.
NodeFilter to be used with this TreeWalker, or null to indicate no filter.
member.exception: NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: Raised if the specified root is null.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Document.CreateTreeWalker(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node)
member.summary: Create a new TreeWalker over the subtree rooted at the specified node.
member.param: node which will serve as the root for the TreeWalker. The whatToShow flags and the NodeFilter are not considered when setting this value; any node type will be accepted as the root. The currentNode of the TreeWalker is initialized to this node, whether or not it is visible. The root functions as a stopping point for traversal methods that look upward in the document structure, such as parentNode and nextNode. The root must not be null.
member.exception: NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: Raised if the specified root is null.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Document.CreateTreeWalker(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node,System.Int64)
member.summary: Create a new TreeWalker over the subtree rooted at the specified node.

The currentNode of the TreeWalker is initialized to this node, whether or not it is visible. The root functions as a stopping point for traversal methods that look upward in the document structure, such as parentNode and nextNode. The root must not be null.

flag specifies which node types may appear in the logical view of the tree presented by the tree-walker. See the description of NodeFilter for the set of possible SHOW_ values.These flags can be combined using OR.
member.exception: NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: Raised if the specified root is null.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Document.CreateTreeWalker(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node,System.Int64,Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.INodeFilter)

The root functions as a stopping point for traversal methods that look upward in the document structure, such as parentNode and nextNode. The root must not be null.

flag specifies which node types may appear in the logical view of the tree presented by the tree-walker. See the description of NodeFilter for the set of possible SHOW_ values.These flags can be combined using OR.
NodeFilter to be used with this TreeWalker, or null to indicate no filter.
member.exception: NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: Raised if the specified root is null.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Document.CreateEvent(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an of a type supported by the implementation.
member.param:
The eventType parameter specifies the type of interface to be created.
If the interface specified is supported by the implementation this method will return a new of the interface type requested. If the is to be dispatched via the method the appropriate method must be called after creation in order to initialize the 's values.
The method is used in creating s when it is either inconvenient or unnecessary for the user to create an themselves. In cases where the implementation provided is insufficient, users may supply their own implementations for use with the method.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Document.CreateExpression(System.String,Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.IXPathNSResolver)
member.summary: Creates a parsed XPath expression with resolved namespaces. This is useful when an expression will be reused in an application since it makes it possible to compile the expression string into a more efficient internal form and preresolve all namespace prefixes which occur within the expression.
member.param: The XPath expression string to be parsed.

The resolver permits translation of all prefixes, including the xml namespace prefix, within the XPath expression into appropriate namespace URIs. If this is specified as null, any namespace prefix within the expression will result in being thrown with the code NAMESPACE_ERR.
member.returns: The compiled form of the XPath expression.
member.exception: INVALID_EXPRESSION_ERR: Raised if the expression is not legal according to the rules of the .
NAMESPACE_ERR: Raised if the expression contains namespace prefixes which cannot be resolved by the specified .

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Document.CreateNSResolver(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node)
member.summary: Adapts any DOM node to resolve namespaces so that an XPath expression can be easily evaluated relative to the context of the node where it appeared within the document. This adapter works like the DOM Level 3 method lookupNamespaceURI on nodes in resolving the namespaceURI from a given prefix using the current information available in the node's hierarchy at the time lookupNamespaceURI is called, also correctly resolving the implicit xml prefix.
member.param: The node to be used as a context for namespace resolution.
member.returns: which resolves namespaces with respect to the definitions in scope for a specified node.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Document.Evaluate(System.String,Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node,Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.IXPathNSResolver,Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType,System.Object)
member.summary: Evaluates an XPath expression string and returns a result of the specified type if possible.
member.param: The XPath expression string to be parsed and evaluated.
The context is context node for the evaluation of this XPath expression.
The resolver permits translation of all prefixes, including the xml namespace prefix, within the XPath expression into appropriate namespace URIs.
If a specific type is specified, then the result will be returned as the corresponding type.
The result specifies a specific result object which may be reused and returned by this method.
member.returns: The result of the evaluation of the XPath expression.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Document.XmlVersion
member.summary: An attribute specifying, as part of the XML declaration, the version number of this document. If there is no declaration and if this document supports the "XML" feature, the value is "1.0". If this document does not support the "XML" feature, the value is always null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Document.StrictErrorChecking
member.summary: An attribute specifying whether error checking is enforced or not. When set to false, the implementation is free to not test every possible error case normally defined on DOM operations, and not raise any DOMException on DOM operations or report errors while using Document.normalizeDocument(). In case of error, the behavior is undefined. This attribute is true by default.
member.value: true if strict error checking; otherwise, false.

member.summary: If an attempt is made to add an attribute that is already in use elsewhere.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.EventTarget
member.summary: The interface is implemented by all Nodes in an implementation which supports the DOM Event Model. Therefore, this interface can be obtained by using binding-specific casting methods on an instance of the Node interface. The interface allows registration and removal of Event Listeners on an and dispatch of events to that .

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.EventTarget.AddEventListener(System.String,Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.DOMEventHandler,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method allows the registration of event listeners on the event target.
member.param: The event type for which the user is registering
Takes an to be called when the event occurs.

If true, useCapture indicates that the user wishes to initiate capture. After initiating capture, all events of the specified type will be dispatched to the registered
before being dispatched to any Event Targets beneath them in the tree. Events which are bubbling upward through the tree will not trigger an designated to use capture.

remarks.para: If an is added to an while it is processing an event, it will not be triggered by the current actions but may be triggered during a later stage of event flow, such as the bubbling phase.

If multiple identical Event Listeners are registered on the same with the same parameters the duplicate instances are discarded. They do not cause the to be called twice and since they are discarded they do not need to be removed with the
method.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.EventTarget.AddEventListener(System.String,Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.IEventListener)
member.summary: This method allows the registration of event listeners on the event target.
member.param: The event type for which the user is registering
Takes an interface implemented by the user which contains the methods to be called when the event occurs.

remarks.para: If an is added to an while it is processing an event, it will not be triggered by the current actions but may be triggered during a later stage of event flow, such as the bubbling phase.

If multiple identical Event Listeners are registered on the same with the same parameters the duplicate instances are discarded. They do not cause the to be called twice and since they are discarded they do not need to be removed with the
method.

member.summary: This method allows the registration of event listeners on the event target.
member.param: The event type for which the user is registering

If true, useCapture indicates that the user wishes to initiate capture. After initiating capture, all events of the specified type will be dispatched to the registered
before being dispatched to any Event Targets beneath them in the tree. Events which are bubbling upward through the tree will not trigger an designated to use capture.

remarks.para: If an is added to an while it is processing an event, it will not be triggered by the current actions but may be triggered during a later stage of event flow, such as the bubbling phase.

If multiple identical Event Listeners are registered on the same with the same parameters the duplicate instances are discarded. They do not cause the to be called twice and since they are discarded they do not need to be removed with the
method.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.EventTarget.RemoveEventListener(System.String,Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.DOMEventHandler,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method allows the removal of event listeners from the event target. If an is removed from an while it is processing an event, it will not be triggered by the current actions. Event Listeners can never be invoked after being removed.
member.param: Specifies the event type of the being removed.
The parameter indicates the to be removed.

Specifies whether the EventListener being removed was registered as a capturing listener or not. If a listener was registered twice, one with capture and one without, each must be removed separately. Removal of a capturing listener does not affect a non-capturing version of the same listener, and vice versa.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.EventTarget.DispatchEvent(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.Event)
member.summary: This method allows the dispatch of events into the implementations event model.
member.param: Specifies the event type, behavior, and contextual information to be used in processing the event.
member.returns: The return value of indicates whether any of the listeners which handled the event called . If was called the value is false, else the value is true.
member.remarks: Events dispatched in this manner will have the same capturing and bubbling behavior as events dispatched directly by the implementation. The target of the event is the on which is called.

member.summary: Returns whether this node has any children.
member.returns: true if has child nodes otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node.Normalize
member.summary: Puts all Text nodes in the full depth of the sub-tree underneath this Node, including attribute nodes, into a "normal" form where only structure (e.g., elements, comments, processing instructions, CDATA sections, and entity references) separates Text nodes, i.e., there are neither adjacent Text nodes nor empty Text nodes. This can be used to ensure that the DOM view of a document is the same as if it were saved and re-loaded, and is useful when operations (such as XPointer [XPointer] lookups) that depend on a particular document tree structure are to be used. If the parameter "normalize-characters" of the DOMConfiguration object attached to the Node.ownerDocument is true, this method will also fully normalize the characters of the Text nodes.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node.CloneNode
member.summary: Returns a duplicate of this node, i.e., serves as a generic copy constructor for nodes. The duplicate node has no parent (parentNode is null) and no user data.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node.CloneNode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a duplicate of this node, i.e., serves as a generic copy constructor for nodes. The duplicate node has no parent (parentNode is null) and no user data.
member.param: if set to true [deep].

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node.IsEqualNode(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node)
member.summary: Tests whether two nodes are equal. This method tests for equality of nodes, not sameness (i.e., whether the two nodes are references to the same object) which can be tested with Node.isSameNode(). All nodes that are the same will also be equal, though the reverse may not be true.
member.param: The other node.
member.returns: true if [is equal node] [the specified arg]; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node.IsSameNode(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node)
member.summary: Returns whether this node is the same node as the given one. This method provides a way to determine whether two Node references returned by the implementation reference the same object. When two Node references are references to the same object, even if through a proxy, the references may be used completely interchangeably, such that all attributes have the same values and calling the same DOM method on either reference always has exactly the same effect.
member.param: The other node.
member.returns: true if [is same node] [the specified other]; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node.LookupPrefix(System.String)
member.summary: Look up the prefix associated to the given namespace URI, starting from this node. The default namespace declarations are ignored by this method. See Namespace Prefix Lookup for details on the algorithm used by this method.
member.param: The namespace URI.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node.LookupNamespaceURI(System.String)
member.summary: Look up the namespace URI associated to the given prefix, starting from this node.
member.param: The prefix.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node.IsDefaultNamespace(System.String)
member.summary: This method checks if the specified namespaceURI is the default namespace or not.
member.param: The namespace URI.
member.returns: true if [is default namespace] [the specified namespace URI]; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node.InsertBefore(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node,Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node)
member.summary: Inserts the node before the existing child node child. If child is null, insert node at the end of the list of children. If child is a DocumentFragment object, all of its children are inserted, in the same order, before child. If the child is already in the tree, it is first removed.
member.param: The new child.
The ref child.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node.ReplaceChild(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node,Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node)
member.summary: Replaces the child node oldChild with newChild in the list of children, and returns the oldChild node. If newChild is a DocumentFragment object, oldChild is replaced by all of the DocumentFragment children, which are inserted in the same order. If the newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed.
member.param: The new node.
The old child.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node.RemoveChild(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node)
member.summary: Removes the child node indicated by oldChild from the list of children, and returns it.
member.param: The old child.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node.AppendChild(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node)
member.summary: Adds the node newChild to the end of the list of children of this node. If the newChild is already in the tree, it is first removed.
member.param: The node to append.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases unmanaged and - optionally - managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node.ParentNode
member.summary: The parent of this node. All nodes, except Attr, Document, DocumentFragment, Entity, and Notation may have a parent. However, if a node has just been created and not yet added to the tree, or if it has been removed from the tree, this is null.

member.summary: Gets the parent of this node.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node.ChildNodes
member.summary: A NodeList that contains all children of this node. If there are no children, this is a NodeList containing no nodes..

member.summary: The first child of this node. If there is no such node, this returns null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node.LastChild
member.summary: The last child of this node. If there is no such node, this returns null.

member.summary: The node immediately preceding this node. If there is no such node, this returns null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node.NextSibling

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node.TextContent
member.summary: This attribute returns the text content of this node and its descendants. When it is defined to be null, setting it has no effect. On setting, any possible children this node may have are removed and, if it the new string is not empty or null, replaced by a single Text node containing the string this attribute is set to.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Text.WholeText

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Text.TextContent

On setting, any possible children this node may have are removed and, if it the new string is not empty or null, replaced by a single Text node containing the string this attribute is set to.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.TypeInfo

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.TypeInfo.DERIVATION_RESTRICTION

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.TypeInfo.DERIVATION_LIST

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.TypeInfo.IsDerivedFrom(System.String,System.String,System.UInt64)
member.summary: This method returns if there is a derivation between the reference type definition, i.e. the TypeInfo on which the method is being called, and the other type definition, i.e. the one passed as parameters.
member.param: the namespace of the other type definition
the name of the other type definition.
the type of derivation and conditions applied between two types, as described in the list of constants provided in this interface.
member.returns: If the document's schema is a DTD or no schema is associated with the document, this method will always return false. If the document's schema is an XML Schema, the method will true if the reference type definition is derived from the other type definition according to the derivation parameter. If the value of the parameter is 0 (no bit is set to 1 for the derivationMethod parameter), the method will return true if the other type definition can be reached by recursing any combination of {base type definition}, {item type definition}, or {member type definitions} from the reference type definition.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.TypeInfo.TypeName

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.TypeInfo.TypeNamespace

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The Aspose.Svg.Dom (Document Object Model) namespace provides API that represents and interacts with any HTML, XML or SVG documents. The DOM is a document model loaded in the browser and representing the document as a node tree, where each node represents part of the document (e.g. an element, text string, or comment).

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.NamespaceGroupDoc
member.summary: This group consists of namespaces and namespace groups responsible for DOM (Document Object Model) processing and HTML, XML or SVG documents tree nodes manipulations. It also includes CSS and SVG related namespaces.

member.summary: Creates a parsed XPath expression with resolved namespaces. This is useful when an expression will be reused in an application since it makes it possible to compile the expression string into a more efficient internal form and preresolve all namespace prefixes which occur within the expression.
member.param: The XPath expression string to be parsed.

The resolver permits translation of all prefixes, including the xml namespace prefix, within the XPath expression into appropriate namespace URIs. If this is specified as null, any namespace prefix within the expression will result in being thrown with the code NAMESPACE_ERR.
member.returns: The compiled form of the XPath expression.
member.exception: INVALID_EXPRESSION_ERR: Raised if the expression is not legal according to the rules of the .
NAMESPACE_ERR: Raised if the expression contains namespace prefixes which cannot be resolved by the specified .

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.IXPathEvaluator.CreateNSResolver(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node)
member.summary: Adapts any DOM node to resolve namespaces so that an XPath expression can be easily evaluated relative to the context of the node where it appeared within the document. This adapter works like the DOM Level 3 method lookupNamespaceURI on nodes in resolving the namespaceURI from a given prefix using the current information available in the node's hierarchy at the time lookupNamespaceURI is called, also correctly resolving the implicit xml prefix.
member.param: The node to be used as a context for namespace resolution.
member.returns: which resolves namespaces with respect to the definitions in scope for a specified node.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.IXPathEvaluator.Evaluate(System.String,Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node,Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.IXPathNSResolver,Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType,System.Object)
member.summary: Evaluates an XPath expression string and returns a result of the specified type if possible.
member.param: The XPath expression string to be parsed and evaluated.

The context is context node for the evaluation of this XPath expression. If the was obtained by casting the then this must be owned by the same document and must be a , , , , , , , or node. If the context node is a or a , then the context is interpreted as the whole logical text node as seen by XPath, unless the node is empty in which case it may not serve as the XPath context.

The resolver permits translation of all prefixes, including the xml namespace prefix, within the XPath expression into appropriate namespace URIs. If this is specified as null, any namespace prefix within the expression will result in being thrown with the code NAMESPACE_ERR.
If a specific type is specified, then the result will be returned as the corresponding type. For XPath 1.0 results, this must be one of the values of the enum.

The result specifies a specific result object which may be reused and returned by this method. If this is specified as null or the implementation does not reuse the specified result, a new result object will be constructed and returned. For XPath 1.0 results, this object will be of type .
member.returns: The result of the evaluation of the XPath expression. For XPath 1.0 results, this object will be of type .
member.exception: INVALID_EXPRESSION_ERR: Raised if the expression is not legal according to the rules of the .
TYPE_ERR: Raised if the result cannot be converted to return the specified type.
NAMESPACE_ERR: Raised if the expression contains namespace prefixes which cannot be resolved by the specified .
WRONG_DOCUMENT_ERR: The Node is from a document that is not supported by this .
NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: The Node is not a type permitted as an XPath context node or the request type is not permitted by this .

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.IXPathNamespace.OwnerElement
member.summary: The on which the namespace was in scope when it was requested. This does not change on a returned namespace node even if the document changes such that the namespace goes out of scope on that element and this node is no longer found there by XPath.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.IXPathNSResolver
member.summary: The XPathNSResolver interface permit prefix strings in the expression to be properly bound to namespaceURI strings. can construct an implementation of from a node, or the interface may be implemented by any application.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.IXPathNSResolver.LookupNamespaceURI(System.String)

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.IXPathResult
member.summary: The XPathResult interface represents the result of the evaluation of an XPath 1.0 expression within the context of a particular node. Since evaluation of an XPath expression can result in various result types, this object makes it possible to discover and manipulate the type and value of the result.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.IXPathResult.IterateNext
member.summary: Iterates and returns the next node from the node set or null if there are no more nodes.
member.exception: TYPE_ERR: raised if resultType is not UnorderedNodeIterator type or OrderedNodeIterator type.
INVALID_STATE_ERR: The document has been mutated since the result was returned.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.IXPathResult.SnapshotItem(System.Int32)

member.returns: The node at the indexth position in the NodeList, or null if that is not a valid index.

member.summary: Signifies that the iterator has become invalid. True if resultType is UnorderedNodeIterator type or OrderedNodeIterator type and the document has been modified since this result was returned.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.IXPathResult.SnapshotLength
member.summary: The number of nodes in the result snapshot. Valid values for snapshotItem indices are 0 to snapshotLength-1 inclusive.
member.exception: TYPE_ERR: raised if resultType is not UnorderedNodeSnapshot type or OrderedNodeSnapshot type.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace contains methods to navigate through elements and attributes in an XML document.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType
member.summary: An unsigned short indicating what type of result this is. If a specific type is specified, then the result will be returned as the corresponding type, using XPath type conversions where required and possible.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType.Any
member.summary: This code does not represent a specific type. An evaluation of an XPath expression will never produce this type. If this type is requested, then the evaluation returns whatever type naturally results from evaluation of the expression. If the natural result is a node set when Any type was requested, then UnorderedNodeIterator is always the resulting type. Any other representation of a node set must be explicitly requested.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType.Number
member.summary: The result is a number as defined by [XPath 1.0]. Document modification does not invalidate the number, but may mean that reevaluation would not yield the same number.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType.String
member.summary: The result is a string as defined by [XPath 1.0]. Document modification does not invalidate the string, but may mean that the string no longer corresponds to the current document.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType.Boolean
member.summary: The result is a boolean as defined by [XPath 1.0]. Document modification does not invalidate the boolean, but may mean that reevaluation would not yield the same boolean.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType.UnorderedNodeIterator
member.summary: The result is a node set as defined by [XPath 1.0] that will be accessed iteratively, which may not produce nodes in a particular order. Document modification invalidates the iteration. This is the default type returned if the result is a node set and Any type is requested.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType.OrderedNodeIterator
member.summary: The result is a node set as defined by [XPath 1.0] that will be accessed iteratively, which will produce document-ordered nodes. Document modification invalidates the iteration.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType.UnorderedNodeSnapshot
member.summary: The result is a node set as defined by [XPath 1.0] that will be accessed as a snapshot list of nodes that may not be in a particular order. Document modification does not invalidate the snapshot but may mean that reevaluation would not yield the same snapshot and nodes in the snapshot may have been altered, moved, or removed from the document.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType.OrderedNodeSnapshot
member.summary: The result is a node set as defined by [XPath 1.0] that will be accessed as a snapshot list of nodes that will be in original document order. Document modification does not invalidate the snapshot but may mean that reevaluation would not yield the same snapshot and nodes in the snapshot may have been altered, moved, or removed from the document.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType.AnyUnorderedNode
member.summary: The result is a node set as defined by [XPath 1.0] and will be accessed as a single node, which may be null if the node set is empty. Document modification does not invalidate the node, but may mean that the result node no longer corresponds to the current document. This is a convenience that permits optimization since the implementation can stop once any node in the resulting set has been found. If there is more than one node in the actual result, the single node returned might not be the first in document order.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.XPath.XPathResultType.FirstOrderedNode
member.summary: The result is a node set as defined by [XPath 1.0] and will be accessed as a single node, which may be null if the node set is empty. Document modification does not invalidate the node, but may mean that the result node no longer corresponds to the current document. This is a convenience that permits optimization since the implementation can stop once the first node in document order of the resulting set has been found. If there are more than one node in the actual result, the single node returned will be the first in document order.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.IDocumentTraversal
member.summary:
DocumentTraversal contains methods that create iterators and tree-walkers to traverse a node and its children in document order (depth first, pre-order traversal, which is equivalent to the order in which the start tags occur in the text representation of the document). In DOMs which support the Traversal feature, DocumentTraversal will be implemented by the same objects that implement the Document interface.
See also the Document object Model (DOM) Level 2 Traversal and Range Specification. @since DOM Level 2

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.IDocumentTraversal.CreateNodeIterator(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node)
member.summary: Create a new NodeIterator over the subtree rooted at the specified node.
member.param: node which will be iterated together with its children. The iterator is initially positioned just before this node. The whatToShow flags and the filter, if any, are not considered when setting this position. The root must not be null.
member.exception: NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: Raised if the specified root is null.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.IDocumentTraversal.CreateNodeIterator(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node,System.Int64)
member.summary: Create a new NodeIterator over the subtree rooted at the specified node.
member.param: node which will be iterated together with its children. The iterator is initially positioned just before this node. The whatToShow flags and the filter, if any, are not considered when setting this position. The root must not be null.

flag specifies which node types may appear in the logical view of the tree presented by the iterator. See the description of NodeFilter for the set of possible SHOW_ values.These flags can be combined using OR.
member.exception: NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: Raised if the specified root is null.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.IDocumentTraversal.CreateNodeIterator(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node,System.Int64,Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.INodeFilter)
member.summary: Create a new NodeIterator over the subtree rooted at the specified node.
member.param: node which will be iterated together with its children. The iterator is initially positioned just before this node. The whatToShow flags and the filter, if any, are not considered when setting this position. The root must not be null.

flag specifies which node types may appear in the logical view of the tree presented by the iterator. See the description of NodeFilter for the set of possible SHOW_ values.These flags can be combined using OR.
NodeFilter to be used with this TreeWalker, or null to indicate no filter.
member.exception: NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: Raised if the specified root is null.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.IDocumentTraversal.CreateTreeWalker(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node)
member.summary: Create a new TreeWalker over the subtree rooted at the specified node.
member.param: node which will serve as the root for the TreeWalker. The whatToShow flags and the NodeFilter are not considered when setting this value; any node type will be accepted as the root. The currentNode of the TreeWalker is initialized to this node, whether or not it is visible. The root functions as a stopping point for traversal methods that look upward in the document structure, such as parentNode and nextNode. The root must not be null.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.IDocumentTraversal.CreateTreeWalker(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node,System.Int64)
member.summary: Create a new TreeWalker over the subtree rooted at the specified node.
member.param: node which will serve as the root for the TreeWalker. The whatToShow flags and the NodeFilter are not considered when setting this value; any node type will be accepted as the root. The currentNode of the TreeWalker is initialized to this node, whether or not it is visible. The root functions as a stopping point for traversal methods that look upward in the document structure, such as parentNode and nextNode. The root must not be null.

flag specifies which node types may appear in the logical view of the tree presented by the tree-walker. See the description of NodeFilter for the set of possible SHOW_ values.These flags can be combined using OR.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.IDocumentTraversal.CreateTreeWalker(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node,System.Int64,Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.INodeFilter)
member.summary: Create a new TreeWalker over the subtree rooted at the specified node.
member.param: node which will serve as the root for the TreeWalker. The whatToShow flags and the NodeFilter are not considered when setting this value; any node type will be accepted as the root. The currentNode of the TreeWalker is initialized to this node, whether or not it is visible. The root functions as a stopping point for traversal methods that look upward in the document structure, such as parentNode and nextNode. The root must not be null.

flag specifies which node types may appear in the logical view of the tree presented by the tree-walker. See the description of NodeFilter for the set of possible SHOW_ values.These flags can be combined using OR.
NodeFilter to be used with this TreeWalker, or null to indicate no filter.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.IElementTraversal
member.summary: The ElementTraversal interface is a set of read-only attributes which allow an author to easily navigate between elements in a document. In conforming implementations of Element Traversal, all objects that implement Element must also implement the ElementTraversal interface.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.IElementTraversal.FirstElementChild
member.summary: Returns the first child element node of this element. null if this element has no child elements.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.IElementTraversal.LastElementChild
member.summary: Returns the last child element node of this element. null if this element has no child elements.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.IElementTraversal.PreviousElementSibling
member.summary: Returns the previous sibling element node of this element. null if this element has no element sibling nodes that come before this one in the document tree.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.IElementTraversal.NextElementSibling
member.summary: Returns the next sibling element node of this element. null if this element has no element sibling nodes that come after this one in the document tree.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.IElementTraversal.ChildElementCount
member.summary: Returns the current number of element nodes that are children of this element. 0 if this element has no child nodes that are of nodeType 1.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.INodeFilter
member.summary:
Filters are objects that know how to "filter out" nodes. If a NodeIterator or TreeWalker is given a NodeFilter, it applies the filter before it returns the next node. If the filter says to accept the node, the traversal logic returns it; otherwise, traversal looks for the next node and pretends that the node that was rejected was not there.
The DOM does not provide any filters. NodeFilter is just an interface that users can implement to provide their own filters.
NodeFilters do not need to know how to traverse from node to node, nor do they need to know anything about the data structure that is being traversed. This makes it very easy to write filters, since the only thing they have to know how to do is evaluate a single node. One filter may be used with a number of different kinds of traversals, encouraging code reuse.
See also the Document object Model (DOM) Level 2 Traversal and Range Specification. @since DOM Level 2

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.INodeFilter.AcceptNode(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node)
member.summary: Test whether a specified node is visible in the logical view of a TreeWalker or NodeIterator. This function will be called by the implementation of TreeWalker and NodeIterator; it is not normally called directly from user code. (Though you could do so if you wanted to use the same filter to guide your own application logic.)
member.param: node to check to see if it passes the filter or not.
member.returns: a constant to determine whether the node is accepted, rejected, or skipped, as defined above.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.INodeIterator
member.summary:
Iterators are used to step through a set of nodes, e.g. the set of nodes in a NodeList, the document subtree governed by a particular Node, the results of a query, or any other set of nodes. The set of nodes to be iterated is determined by the implementation of the NodeIterator. DOM Level 2 specifies a single NodeIterator implementation for document-order traversal of a document subtree. Instances of these iterators are created by calling DocumentTraversal .createNodeIterator().
See also the Document object Model (DOM) Level 2 Traversal and Range Specification. @since DOM Level 2

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.INodeIterator.NextNode
member.summary: Returns the next node in the set and advances the position of the iterator in the set. After a NodeIterator is created, the first call to nextNode() returns the first node in the set.
member.returns: The next Node in the set being iterated over, or null if there are no more members in that set.
member.exception: INVALID_STATE_ERR: Raised if this method is called after the detach method was invoked.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.INodeIterator.PreviousNode
member.summary: Returns the previous node in the set and moves the position of the NodeIterator backwards in the set.
member.returns: The previous Node in the set being iterated over, or null if there are no more members in that set.
member.exception: INVALID_STATE_ERR: Raised if this method is called after the detach method was invoked.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.INodeIterator.Detach
member.summary: Detaches the NodeIterator from the set which it iterated over, releasing any computational resources and placing the iterator in the INVALID state. After detach has been invoked, calls to nextNode or previousNode will raise the exception INVALID_STATE_ERR.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.INodeIterator.ReferenceNode
member.summary: The current reference node.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.INodeIterator.PointerBeforeReferenceNode
member.summary: The value of this flag determines whether the children of entity reference nodes are visible to the iterator. If false, they and their descendants will be rejected. Note that this rejection takes precedence over whatToShow and the filter. Also note that this is currently the only situation where NodeIterators may reject a complete subtree rather than skipping individual nodes. To produce a view of the document that has entity references expanded and does not expose the entity reference node itself, use the whatToShow flags to hide the entity reference node and set expandEntityReferences to true when creating the iterator. To produce a view of the document that has entity reference nodes but no entity expansion, use the whatToShow flags to show the entity reference node and set expandEntityReferences to false.
member.value: true if [expand entity references]; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.ITraversal
member.summary:
Iterators are used to step through a set of nodes, e.g. the set of nodes in a NodeList, the document subtree governed by a particular Node, the results of a query, or any other set of nodes. The set of nodes to be iterated is determined by the implementation of the NodeIterator. DOM Level 2 specifies a single NodeIterator implementation for document-order traversal of a document subtree. Instances of these iterators are created by calling DocumentTraversal .createNodeIterator().
See also the Document object Model (DOM) Level 2 Traversal and Range Specification. @since DOM Level 2

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.ITraversal.Root
member.summary: The root node of the NodeIterator, as specified when it was created.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.ITraversal.WhatToShow
member.summary: This attribute determines which node types are presented via the iterator. The available set of constants is defined in the NodeFilter interface. Nodes not accepted by whatToShow will be skipped, but their children may still be considered. Note that this skip takes precedence over the filter, if any.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.ITraversal.Filter
member.summary: The NodeFilter used to screen nodes.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.ITreeWalker
member.summary:
TreeWalker objects are used to navigate a document tree or subtree using the view of the document defined by their whatToShow flags and filter (if any). Any function which performs navigation using a TreeWalker will automatically support any view defined by a TreeWalker.
Omitting nodes from the logical view of a subtree can result in a structure that is substantially different from the same subtree in the complete, unfiltered document. Nodes that are siblings in the TreeWalker view may be children of different, widely separated nodes in the original view. For instance, consider a NodeFilter that skips all nodes except for Text nodes and the root node of a document. In the logical view that results, all text nodes will be siblings and appear as direct children of the root node, no matter how deeply nested the structure of the original document.
See also the Document object Model (DOM) Level 2 Traversal and Range Specification. @since DOM Level 2

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.ITreeWalker.ParentNode
member.summary: Moves to and returns the closest visible ancestor node of the current node. If the search for parentNode attempts to step upward from the TreeWalker's root node, or if it fails to find a visible ancestor node, this method retains the current position and returns null.
member.returns: The new parent node, or null if the current node has no parent in the TreeWalker's logical view.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.ITreeWalker.FirstChild
member.summary: Moves the TreeWalker to the first visible child of the current node, and returns the new node. If the current node has no visible children, returns null, and retains the current node.
member.returns: The new node, or null if the current node has no visible children in the TreeWalker's logical view.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.ITreeWalker.LastChild
member.summary: Moves the TreeWalker to the last visible child of the current node, and returns the new node. If the current node has no visible children, returns null, and retains the current node.
member.returns: The new node, or null if the current node has no children in the TreeWalker's logical view.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.ITreeWalker.PreviousSibling
member.summary: Moves the TreeWalker to the previous sibling of the current node, and returns the new node. If the current node has no visible previous sibling, returns null, and retains the current node.
member.returns: The new node, or null if the current node has no previous sibling. in the TreeWalker's logical view.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.ITreeWalker.NextSibling
member.summary: Moves the TreeWalker to the next sibling of the current node, and returns the new node. If the current node has no visible next sibling, returns null, and retains the current node.
member.returns: The new node, or null if the current node has no next sibling. in the TreeWalker's logical view.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.ITreeWalker.PreviousNode
member.summary: Moves the TreeWalker to the previous visible node in document order relative to the current node, and returns the new node. If the current node has no previous node, or if the search for previousNode attempts to step upward from the TreeWalker's root node, returns null, and retains the current node.
member.returns: The new node, or null if the current node has no previous node in the TreeWalker's logical view.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.ITreeWalker.NextNode
member.summary: Moves the TreeWalker to the next visible node in document order relative to the current node, and returns the new node. If the current node has no next node, or if the search for nextNode attempts to step upward from the TreeWalker's root node, returns null, and retains the current node.
member.returns: The new node, or null if the current node has no next node in the TreeWalker's logical view.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.ITreeWalker.CurrentNode
member.summary: The node at which the TreeWalker is currently positioned. Alterations to the DOM tree may cause the current node to no longer be accepted by the TreeWalker's associated filter. currentNode may also be explicitly set to any node, whether or not it is within the subtree specified by the root node or would be accepted by the filter and whatToShow flags. Further traversal occurs relative to currentNode even if it is not part of the current view, by applying the filters in the requested direction; if no traversal is possible, currentNode is not changed.
member.exception: NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: Raised if an attempt is made to set currentNode to null.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal namespace contains methods that create iterators and tree-walkers to navigate between elements and traverse a node and its children in document order.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.NamespaceGroupDoc
member.summary: This namespace group contains namespaces which are responsible for iterators and tree-walkers creation to navigate between elements and traverse a node and its children in document order. It also contains namespace for tree navigation filtering.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.Filters.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace represented by node filtering functionality. Filters are objects that know how to "filter out" nodes. If a node iterator or tree walker is given a node filter, it applies the filter before it returns the next node. If the filter says to accept the node, the traversal logic returns it; otherwise, traversal looks for the next node and pretends that the node that was rejected was not there.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.Filters.NodeFilter
member.summary: Filters are objects that know how to "filter out" nodes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.Filters.NodeFilter.FILTER_ACCEPT
member.summary: Accept the node. Navigation methods defined for NodeIterator or TreeWalker will return this node.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.Filters.NodeFilter.FILTER_REJECT
member.summary: Reject the node. Navigation methods defined for NodeIterator or TreeWalker will not return this node. For TreeWalker, the children of this node will also be rejected. NodeIterators treat this as a synonym for FILTER_SKIP.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.Filters.NodeFilter.FILTER_SKIP
member.summary: Skip this single node. Navigation methods defined for NodeIterator or TreeWalker will not return this node. For both NodeIterator and TreeWalker, the children of this node will still be considered.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.Filters.NodeFilter.SHOW_ALL
member.summary: Show all Nodes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.Filters.NodeFilter.SHOW_ELEMENT
member.summary: Show Element nodes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.Filters.NodeFilter.SHOW_ATTRIBUTE
member.summary: Show Attr nodes. This is meaningful only when creating an iterator or tree-walker with an attribute node as its root; in this case, it means that the attribute node will appear in the first position of the iteration or traversal. Since attributes are never children of other nodes, they do not appear when traversing over the document tree.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.Filters.NodeFilter.SHOW_TEXT
member.summary: Show Text nodes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.Filters.NodeFilter.SHOW_CDATA_SECTION
member.summary: Show CDATASection nodes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.Filters.NodeFilter.SHOW_ENTITY_REFERENCE
member.summary: Show EntityReference nodes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.Filters.NodeFilter.SHOW_ENTITY
member.summary: Show Entity nodes. This is meaningful only when creating an iterator or tree-walker with an Entity node as its root; in this case, it means that the Entity node will appear in the first position of the traversal. Since entities are not part of the document tree, they do not appear when traversing over the document tree.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.Filters.NodeFilter.SHOW_PROCESSING_INSTRUCTION
member.summary: Show ProcessingInstruction nodes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.Filters.NodeFilter.SHOW_COMMENT
member.summary: Show Comment nodes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.Filters.NodeFilter.SHOW_DOCUMENT
member.summary: Show Document nodes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.Filters.NodeFilter.SHOW_DOCUMENT_TYPE
member.summary: Show DocumentType nodes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.Filters.NodeFilter.SHOW_DOCUMENT_FRAGMENT
member.summary: Show DocumentFragment nodes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.Filters.NodeFilter.SHOW_NOTATION
member.summary: Show Notation nodes. This is meaningful only when creating an iterator or tree-walker with a Notation node as its root; in this case, it means that the Notation node will appear in the first position of the traversal. Since notations are not part of the document tree, they do not appear when traversing over the document tree.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Traversal.Filters.NodeFilter.AcceptNode(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Node)
member.summary: Test whether a specified node is visible in the logical view of a TreeWalker or NodeIterator. This function will be called by the implementation of TreeWalker and NodeIterator; it is not normally called directly from user code. (Though you could do so if you wanted to use the same filter to guide your own application logic.)
member.param: node to check to see if it passes the filter or not.
member.returns: a constant to determine whether the node is accepted, rejected, or skipped, as defined above.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Mutations.MutationRecord.OldValue
member.summary: The return value depends on type. For "attributes", it is the value of the changed attribute before the change. For "characterData", it is the data of the changed node before the change. For "childList", it is null.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.Event
member.summary: The is used to provide contextual information about an event to the handler processing the event.
member.remarks: An object which implements the is generally passed as the first parameter to an event handler. More specific context information is passed to event handlers by deriving additional interfaces from which contain information directly relating to the type of event they accompany. These derived interfaces are also implemented by the object passed to the event listener.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.Event.PreventDefault
member.summary: If an event is cancelable, the method is used to signify that the event is to be canceled, meaning any default action normally taken by the implementation as a result of the event will not occur.
member.remarks: If, during any stage of event flow, the method is called the event is canceled. Any default action associated with the event will not occur. Calling this method for a non-cancelable event has no effect. Once has been called it will remain in effect throughout the remainder of the event's propagation. This method may be used during any stage of event flow.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.Event.StopPropagation
member.summary: The method is used prevent further propagation of an event during event flow.
member.remarks: If this method is called by any the event will cease propagating through the tree. The event will complete dispatch to all listeners on the current before event flow stops. This method may be used during any stage of event flow.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.Event.StopImmediatePropagation
member.summary: Invoking this method prevents event from reaching any event listeners registered after the current one and when dispatched in a tree also prevents event from reaching any other objects.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.Event.Bubbles
member.summary: Used to indicate whether or not an event is a bubbling event. If the event can bubble the value is true, else the value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.Event.Cancelable
member.summary: Used to indicate whether or not an event can have its default action prevented. If the default action can be prevented the value is true, else the value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.Event.CurrentTarget
member.summary: Used to indicate the whose s are currently being processed. This is particularly useful during capturing and bubbling.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.Event.EventPhase
member.summary: Used to indicate which phase of event flow is currently being evaluated.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.Event.Target
member.summary: Used to indicate the to which the event was originally dispatched.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.Event.TimeStamp
member.summary: Used to specify the time (in milliseconds relative to the epoch) at which the event was created. Due to the fact that some systems may not provide this information the value of timeStamp may be not available for all events. When not available, a value of 0 will be returned. Examples of epoch time are the time of the system start or 0:0:0 UTC 1st January 1970.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.Event.Type
member.summary: The name of the event (case-insensitive). The name must be an XML name.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.IDocumentEvent.CreateEvent(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an of a type supported by the implementation.
member.param:
The eventType parameter specifies the type of interface to be created.
If the interface specified is supported by the implementation this method will return a new of the interface type requested. If the is to be dispatched via the method the appropriate method must be called after creation in order to initialize the 's values.
The method is used in creating s when it is either inconvenient or unnecessary for the user to create an themselves. In cases where the implementation provided is insufficient, users may supply their own implementations for use with the method.
member.exception: NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR: Raised if the implementation does not support the type of interface requested

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.IEventListener
member.summary: The interface is the primary method for handling events. Users implement the interface and register their listener on an using the method. The users should also remove their from its after they have completed using the listener.
member.remarks: When a Node is copied using the cloneNode method the Event Listeners attached to the source Node are not attached to the copied Node. If the user wishes the same Event Listeners to be added to the newly created copy the user must add them manually.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.IEventListener.HandleEvent(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.Event)
member.summary: This method is called whenever an event occurs of the type for which the interface was registered.
member.param: The contains contextual information about the event. It also contains the and methods which are used in determining the event's flow and default action.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.IEventTarget
member.summary: The interface is implemented by all Nodes in an implementation which supports the DOM Event Model. Therefore, this interface can be obtained by using binding-specific casting methods on an instance of the Node interface. The interface allows registration and removal of Event Listeners on an and dispatch of events to that .

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.IEventTarget.AddEventListener(System.String,Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.IEventListener)
member.summary: This method allows the registration of event listeners on the event target.
member.param: The event type for which the user is registering
Takes an interface implemented by the user which contains the methods to be called when the event occurs.

remarks.para: If an is added to an while it is processing an event, it will not be triggered by the current actions but may be triggered during a later stage of event flow, such as the bubbling phase.

If multiple identical Event Listeners are registered on the same with the same parameters the duplicate instances are discarded. They do not cause the to be called twice and since they are discarded they do not need to be removed with the
method.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.IEventTarget.AddEventListener(System.String,Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.IEventListener,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method allows the registration of event listeners on the event target.
member.param: The event type for which the user is registering
Takes an interface implemented by the user which contains the methods to be called when the event occurs.

If true, useCapture indicates that the user wishes to initiate capture. After initiating capture, all events of the specified type will be dispatched to the registered
before being dispatched to any Event Targets beneath them in the tree. Events which are bubbling upward through the tree will not trigger an designated to use capture.

remarks.para: If an is added to an while it is processing an event, it will not be triggered by the current actions but may be triggered during a later stage of event flow, such as the bubbling phase.

If multiple identical Event Listeners are registered on the same with the same parameters the duplicate instances are discarded. They do not cause the to be called twice and since they are discarded they do not need to be removed with the
method.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.IEventTarget.RemoveEventListener(System.String,Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.IEventListener)
member.summary: This method allows the removal of event listeners from the event target. If an is removed from an while it is processing an event, it will not be triggered by the current actions. Event Listeners can never be invoked after being removed.
member.param: Specifies the event type of the being removed.
The parameter indicates the to be removed.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.IEventTarget.RemoveEventListener(System.String,Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.IEventListener,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method allows the removal of event listeners from the event target. If an is removed from an while it is processing an event, it will not be triggered by the current actions. Event Listeners can never be invoked after being removed.
member.param: Specifies the event type of the being removed.
The parameter indicates the to be removed.

Specifies whether the EventListener being removed was registered as a capturing listener or not. If a listener was registered twice, one with capture and one without, each must be removed separately. Removal of a capturing listener does not affect a non-capturing version of the same listener, and vice versa.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.IEventTarget.DispatchEvent(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.Event)
member.summary: This method allows the dispatch of events into the implementations event model.
member.param: Specifies the event type, behavior, and contextual information to be used in processing the event.
member.returns: The return value of indicates whether any of the listeners which handled the event called . If was called the value is false, else the value is true.
member.remarks: Events dispatched in this manner will have the same capturing and bubbling behavior as events dispatched directly by the implementation. The target of the event is the on which is called.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.InputEvent
member.summary: Input events are sent as notifications whenever the DOM is being updated.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.InputEvent.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The event type.
