member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The event type.
The event initialize dictionary.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.InputEvent.Data
member.summary: The data holds the value of the characters generated by an input method. This MAY be a single Unicode character or a non-empty sequence of Unicode characters [Unicode]. Characters SHOULD be normalized as defined by the Unicode normalization form NFC, defined in [UAX15]. This attribute MAY contain the empty string.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.InputEvent.IsComposing
member.summary: true if the input event occurs as part of a composition session, i.e., after a compositionstart event and before the corresponding compositionend event. The un-initialized value of this attribute MUST be false.
member.value: true if this instance is composing; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.KeyboardEvent
member.summary: The KeyboardEvent interface provides specific contextual information associated with keyboard devices. Each keyboard event references a key using a value. Keyboard events are commonly directed at the element that has the focus.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.KeyboardEvent.DOM_KEY_LOCATION_STANDARD
member.summary: The key activation MUST NOT be distinguished as the left or right version of the key, and (other than the NumLock key) did not originate from the numeric keypad (or did not originate with a virtual key corresponding to the numeric keypad).

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.KeyboardEvent.DOM_KEY_LOCATION_LEFT
member.summary: The key activated originated from the left key location (when there is more than one possible location for this key).

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.KeyboardEvent.DOM_KEY_LOCATION_RIGHT
member.summary: The key activation originated from the right key location (when there is more than one possible location for this key).

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.KeyboardEvent.DOM_KEY_LOCATION_NUMPAD
member.summary: The key activation originated on the numeric keypad or with a virtual key corresponding to the numeric keypad (when there is more than one possible location for this key). Note that the NumLock key should always be encoded with a location of DOM_KEY_LOCATION_STANDARD.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.KeyboardEvent.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The event type.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.KeyboardEvent.#ctor(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The event type.
The event initialize dictionary.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.KeyboardEvent.Key
member.summary: The key holds the key value of the key pressed. If the value is has a printed representation, it MUST be a non-empty Unicode character string, conforming to the algorithm for determining the key value defined in this specification. If the value is a control key which has no printed representation, it MUST be one of the key values defined in the key values set, as determined by the algorithm for determining the key value. Implementations that are unable to identify a key MUST use the key value Unidentified.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.KeyboardEvent.Code
member.summary: The code holds a string that identifies the physical key being pressed. The value is not affected by the current keyboard layout or modifier state, so a particular key will always return the same value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.KeyboardEvent.Location
member.summary: The location attribute contains an indication of the logical location of the key on the device.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.KeyboardEvent.CtrlKey
member.summary: true if the Control (control) key modifier was active. The un-initialized value of this attribute MUST be false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.KeyboardEvent.ShiftKey
member.summary: true if the shift (Shift) key modifier was active.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.KeyboardEvent.AltKey
member.summary: true if the Alt (alternative) (or "Option") key modifier was active. The un-initialized value of this attribute MUST be false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.KeyboardEvent.MetaKey
member.summary: true if the meta (Meta) key modifier was active.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.KeyboardEvent.Repeat
member.summary: true if the key has been pressed in a sustained manner. Holding down a key MUST result in the repeating the events keydown, beforeinput, input in this order, at a rate determined by the system configuration. For mobile devices which have long-key-press behavior, the first key event with a repeat attribute value of true MUST serve as an indication of a long-key-press. The length of time that the key MUST be pressed in order to begin repeating is configuration-dependent.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.KeyboardEvent.IsComposing
member.summary: true if the key event occurs as part of a composition session, i.e., after a compositionstart event and before the corresponding compositionend event. The un-initialized value of this attribute MUST be false.
member.value: true if this instance is composing; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Refer to the ctrlKey attribute.

member.summary: Refer to the shiftKey attribute.

member.summary: Refer to the metaKey attribute.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.MouseEvent.Button
member.summary: During mouse events caused by the depression or release of a mouse button, button MUST be used to indicate which pointer device button changed state.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.MouseEvent.Buttons
member.summary: During any mouse events, buttons MUST be used to indicate which combination of mouse buttons are currently being pressed, expressed as a bitmask.

member.summary: Used to identify a secondary EventTarget related to a UI event, depending on the type of event.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.WheelEvent
member.summary: The WheelEvent interface provides specific contextual information associated with wheel events. To create an instance of the WheelEvent interface, use the WheelEvent constructor, passing an optional WheelEventInit dictionary.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.WheelEvent.DOM_DELTA_PIXEL
member.summary: The units of measurement for the delta MUST be pixels. This is the most typical case in most operating system and implementation configurations.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.WheelEvent.DOM_DELTA_LINE
member.summary: The units of measurement for the delta MUST be individual lines of text. This is the case for many form controls.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.WheelEvent.DOM_DELTA_PAGE
member.summary: The units of measurement for the delta MUST be pages, either defined as a single screen or as a demarcated page.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.WheelEvent.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The event type.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.WheelEvent.#ctor(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The event type.
The event initialize dictionary.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.WheelEvent.DeltaX
member.summary: In user agents where the default action of the wheel event is to scroll, the value MUST be the measurement along the x-axis (in pixels, lines, or pages) to be scrolled in the case where the event is not cancelled. Otherwise, this is an implementation-specific measurement (in pixels, lines, or pages) of the movement of a wheel device around the x-axis.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.WheelEvent.DeltaY
member.summary: In user agents where the default action of the wheel event is to scroll, the value MUST be the measurement along the y-axis (in pixels, lines, or pages) to be scrolled in the case where the event is not cancelled. Otherwise, this is an implementation-specific measurement (in pixels, lines, or pages) of the movement of a wheel device around the y-axis.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.WheelEvent.DeltaZ
member.summary: In user agents where the default action of the wheel event is to scroll, the value MUST be the measurement along the z-axis (in pixels, lines, or pages) to be scrolled in the case where the event is not cancelled. Otherwise, this is an implementation-specific measurement (in pixels, lines, or pages) of the movement of a wheel device around the z-axis.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Events.WheelEvent.DeltaMode
member.summary: The deltaMode attribute contains an indication of the units of measurement for the delta values. The default value is DOM_DELTA_PIXEL (pixels).

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSRule
member.summary: The CSSRule interface is the abstract base interface for any type of CSS statement. This includes both rule sets and at-rules. An implementation is expected to preserve all rules specified in a CSS style sheet, even if the rule is not recognized by the parser. Unrecognized rules are represented using the interface.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSRule.Type
member.summary: The type of the rule, as defined above. The expectation is that binding-specific casting methods can be used to cast down from an instance of the CSSRule interface to the specific derived interface implied by the type.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSRule.CSSText
member.summary: The parsable textual representation of the rule. This reflects the current state of the rule and not its initial value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSRule.ParentStyleSheet
member.summary: The style sheet that contains this rule.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSRule.ParentRule
member.summary: If this rule is contained inside another rule (e.g. a style rule inside an @media block), this is the containing rule. If this rule is not nested inside any other rules, this returns null.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSRuleList
member.summary: The CSSRuleList interface provides the abstraction of an ordered collection of CSS rules.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSRuleList.Length
member.summary: The number of CSSRules in the list. The range of valid child rule indices is 0 to length-1 inclusive.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSRuleList.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Used to retrieve a CSS rule by method item() (http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-2-Style/css.html#CSS-CSSRuleList). The order in this collection represents the order of the rules in the CSS style sheet. If index is greater than or equal to the number of rules in the list, this returns null.
member.param: The rule index

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSStyleDeclaration
member.summary: The CSSStyleDeclaration interface represents a single CSS declaration block. This interface may be used to determine the style properties currently set in a block or to set style properties explicitly within the block.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSStyleDeclaration.GetPropertyValue(System.String)
member.summary: Used to retrieve the value of a CSS property if it has been explicitly set within this declaration block.
member.param: Name of the property.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSStyleDeclaration.GetPropertyCSSValue(System.String)
member.summary: Used to retrieve the object representation of the value of a CSS property if it has been explicitly set within this declaration block. This method returns null if the property is a shorthand property. Shorthand property values can only be accessed and modified as strings, using the getPropertyValue and setProperty methods.
member.param: Name of the property.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSStyleDeclaration.RemoveProperty(System.String)
member.summary: Used to remove a CSS property if it has been explicitly set within this declaration block.
member.param: Name of the property.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSStyleDeclaration.GetPropertyPriority(System.String)
member.summary: Used to retrieve the priority of a CSS property (e.g. the "important" qualifier) if the property has been explicitly set in this declaration block.
member.param: Name of the property.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSStyleDeclaration.SetProperty(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Used to set a property value with default priority within this declaration block. Default priority is not "important" i.e. String.Empty
member.param: Name of the property.
The value.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSStyleDeclaration.SetProperty(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Used to set a property value and priority within this declaration block.
member.param: Name of the property.
The value.
The priority.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSStyleDeclaration.CSSText
member.summary: The parsable textual representation of the declaration block (excluding the surrounding curly braces). Setting this attribute will result in the parsing of the new value and resetting of all the properties in the declaration block including the removal or addition of properties.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSStyleDeclaration.Length
member.summary: The number of properties that have been explicitly set in this declaration block. The range of valid indices is 0 to length-1 inclusive.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSStyleDeclaration.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Used to retrieve the properties that have been explicitly set in this declaration block. The order of the properties retrieved using this method does not have to be the order in which they were set. This method can be used to iterate over all properties in this declaration block.
member.param: The property index

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSStyleDeclaration.ParentRule
member.summary: The CSS rule that contains this declaration block or null if this CSSStyleDeclaration is not attached to a CSSRule.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSStyleSheet
member.summary: The CSSStyleSheet interface is a concrete interface used to represent a CSS style sheet i.e., a style sheet whose content type is "text/css".

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSStyleSheet.InsertRule(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Used to insert a new rule into the style sheet. The new rule now becomes part of the cascade.
member.param: The style rule.
The rule index.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSStyleSheet.DeleteRule(System.Int32)
member.summary: Used to delete a rule from the style sheet.
member.param: The index.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSStyleSheet.OwnerRule
member.summary: If this style sheet comes from an @import rule, the ownerRule attribute will contain the CSSImportRule. In that case, the ownerNode attribute in the StyleSheet interface will be null. If the style sheet comes from an element or a processing instruction, the ownerRule attribute will be null and the ownerNode attribute will contain the Node.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ICSSStyleSheet.CSSRules
member.summary: The list of all CSS rules contained within the style sheet. This includes both rule sets and at-rules.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.IDocumentStyle
member.summary: The DocumentStyle interface provides a mechanism by which the style sheets embedded in a document can be retrieved. The expectation is that an instance of the DocumentStyle interface can be obtained by using binding-specific casting methods on an instance of the Document interface.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.IDocumentStyle.StyleSheets
member.summary: A list containing all the style sheets explicitly linked into or embedded in a document. For HTML documents, this includes external style sheets, included via the HTML LINK element, and inline STYLE elements.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ILinkStyle
member.summary: The LinkStyle interface provides a mechanism by which a style sheet can be retrieved from the node responsible for linking it into a document. An instance of the LinkStyle interface can be obtained using binding-specific casting methods on an instance of a linking node (HTMLLinkElement, HTMLStyleElement or ProcessingInstruction in DOM Level 2).

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.ILinkStyle.Sheet
member.summary: Gets the associated style sheet.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.IMediaList
member.summary: The MediaList interface provides the abstraction of an ordered collection of media, without defining or constraining how this collection is implemented. An empty list is the same as a list that contains the medium "all".

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.IMediaList.DeleteMedium(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the medium indicated by oldMedium from the list.
member.param: The old medium.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.IMediaList.AppendMedium(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the medium newMedium to the end of the list. If the newMedium is already used, it is first removed.
member.param: The new medium.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.IMediaList.MediaText
member.summary: The parsable textual representation of the media list. This is a comma-separated list of media.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.IMediaList.Length
member.summary: The number of media in the list. The range of valid media is 0 to length-1 inclusive.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.IMediaList.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the indexth in the list. If index is greater than or equal to the number of media in the list, this returns null. The media index.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.IStyleSheet
member.summary: The StyleSheet interface is the abstract base interface for any type of style sheet. It represents a single style sheet associated with a structured document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.IStyleSheet.Type
member.summary: This specifies the style sheet language for this style sheet. The style sheet language is specified as a content type (e.g. "text/css").

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.IStyleSheet.Disabled
member.summary: false if the style sheet is applied to the document. true if it is not. Modifying this attribute may cause a new resolution of style for the document. A stylesheet only applies if both an appropriate medium definition is present and the disabled attribute is false. So, if the media doesn't apply to the current user agent, the disabled attribute is ignored.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.IStyleSheet.OwnerNode
member.summary: The node that associates this style sheet with the document. For HTML, this may be the corresponding LINK or STYLE element. For XML, it may be the linking processing instruction. For style sheets that are included by other style sheets, the value of this attribute is null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.IStyleSheet.ParentStyleSheet
member.summary: For style sheet languages that support the concept of style sheet inclusion, this attribute represents the including style sheet, if one exists. If the style sheet is a top-level style sheet, or the style sheet language does not support inclusion, the value of this attribute is null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.IStyleSheet.Href
member.summary: If the style sheet is a linked style sheet, the value of its attribute is its location. For inline style sheets, the value of this attribute is null.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.IStyleSheet.Title
member.summary: The advisory title.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.IStyleSheet.Media
member.summary: The intended destination media for style information.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.IStyleSheetList
member.summary: The StyleSheetList interface provides the abstraction of an ordered collection of style sheets.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.IStyleSheetList.Length
member.summary: The number of StyleSheets in the list. The range of valid child stylesheet indices is 0 to length-1 inclusive.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.IStyleSheetList.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Used to retrieve a style sheet by method item(int index) accordind to http://www.w3.org/TR/2000/REC-DOM-Level-2-Style-20001113/stylesheets.html.
member.param: The style sheet index

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.IViewCSS
member.summary: This interface represents a CSS view.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.IViewCSS.GetComputedStyle(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Element)
member.summary: This method is used to get the computed style as it is defined in CSS2.
member.param: The element whose style is to be computed. This parameter cannot be null.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Dom.Css.IViewCSS.GetComputedStyle(Aspose.Svg.Dom.Element,System.String)
member.summary: This method is used to get the computed style as it is defined in CSS2.
member.param: The element whose style is to be computed. This parameter cannot be null.
The pseudo element.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Drawing.Color
member.summary: The Color class lets you specify colors as Red-Green-Blue (RGB) values, Hue-Saturation-Luminosity (HSL) values, Hue-Saturation-Value (HSV) values, Hue-Whiteness-Blackness (HWB) values, lightness-A-B (LAB) values, Luminance-Chroma-Hue (LCH) values, Cyan-Magenta-Yellow-Key (CMYK) values, Natural colors (NCOL) values, or with a color name. An Alpha channel is also available to indicate transparency.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Drawing.Color.#ctor

member.param: The red component of the color.

The blue component of the color.
The alpha component of the color.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:

ms.p: 2. The folder that contains the Aspose component assembly.
3. The folder that contains the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder that contains the entry (startup) assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

java.p: 2. The folder that contains the Aspose component JAR file.
3. The folder that contains the client's calling JAR file.

member.param: Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.summary: Sets metered public and private key. If you purchase metered license, when start application, this API should be called, normally, this is enough. member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.Device`2.ClosePath
member.summary: Closes the current subpath by appending a straight line segment from the current point to the starting point of the subpath. If the current subpath is already closed, "ClosePath" does nothing. This operator terminates the current subpath. Appending another segment to the current path begins a new subpath, even if the new segment begins at the endpoint reached by the "ClosePath" method.

member.param: Point of where to create the line to.

member.summary: Appends a cubic BÃ©zier curve to the current path. The curve extends from the current point to the point pt2, using pt1 and pt2 as the BÃ©zier control points. The new current point is pt3.
member.param: Coordinates of first point
Coordinates of second point
Coordinates of third point

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.Device`2.Stroke
member.summary: Strokes a line along the current path. The stroked line follows each straight or curved segment in the path, centered on the segment with sides parallel to it. Each of the pathâ€™s subpaths is treated separately. This method terminates current path.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.Device`2.Fill(Aspose.Svg.Drawing.FillRule)
member.summary: Fills the entire region enclosed by the current path. If the path consists of several disconnected subpaths, it fills the insides of all subpaths, considered together. This method terminates current path.
member.param: Filling mode specifies how the interior of a closed path is filled

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.Device`2.Clip(Aspose.Svg.Drawing.FillRule)
member.summary: Modifies the current clipping path by intersecting it with the current path, using the FillMode rule to determine the region to fill. This method terminates current path.
member.param: Filling mode specifies how the interior of a closed path is clipped

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.DeviceAdapter.ClosePath
member.summary: Closes the current subpath by appending a straight line segment from the current point to the starting point of the subpath. If the current subpath is already closed, "ClosePath" does nothing. This operator terminates the current subpath. Appending another segment to the current path begins a new subpath, even if the new segment begins at the endpoint reached by the "ClosePath" method.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.DeviceAdapter.Stroke
member.summary: Strokes a line along the current path. The stroked line follows each straight or curved segment in the path, centered on the segment with sides parallel to it. Each of the pathâ€™s subpaths is treated separately. This method terminates current path.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.ClipStrategy
member.summary: Specifies the strategy for clipping an SVG element. This enum is used to determine how to apply clipping paths or masks to SVG elements during rendering.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.ClipStrategy.None
member.summary: Indicates that no clipping will be applied to the SVG element. This strategy is used when there is no clip-path or mask associated with the SVG element.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.ClipStrategy.Mask
member.summary: This strategy applies a mask for clipping. This strategy is used when the SVG element has a mask element applied to it. Instead of clipping the canvas, a mask layer is used to determine the visibility of the SVG element. A mask is an image where the alpha value of each pixel is used to determine the visibility of the corresponding pixel in the SVG element.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.ClipStrategy.Path
member.summary: This strategy uses a path for clipping. This strategy is used when the SVG element has a clipPath element applied to it. A clipPath is a region defined by a path; anything outside of this path is clipped out.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.Styles.NamespaceDoc
member.summary:
The Aspose.Svg.Rendering.Styles namespace contains classes and interfaces defining various style properties of SVG elements during rendering. This includes color schemes, gradients, patterns, fill styles, and other stylistic elements that influence the visual appearance of the SVG elements.
These styles are essential for maintaining the integrity of the SVG documents and ensuring they are rendered as per the original design specifications.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.Styles.PaintServers.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The Aspose.Svg.Rendering.Styles.PaintServers namespace contains classes and interfaces for handling SVG paint servers. Paint servers are elements that define graphical templates in SVG, such as gradients and patterns, which can be reused in SVG documents. This includes linear gradients, radial gradients, and pattern fills, which can be applied to the fill or stroke of SVG shapes. This namespace encapsulates the logic needed to parse, interpret, and render these paint servers in accordance with the SVG specification.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.Pdf.Encryption.PdfEncryptionInfo.UserPassword
member.summary: Gets or sets the User password.
member.remarks: Opening the document with the correct user password (or opening a document that does not have a user password) allows additional operations to be performed according to the user access permissions specified in the documentâ€™s encryption dictionary.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.Pdf.Encryption.PdfEncryptionInfo.OwnerPassword
member.summary: Gets or sets the Owner password.
member.remarks: Opening the document with the correct owner password (assuming it is not the same as the user password) allows full (owner) access to the document. This unlimited access includes the ability to change the documentâ€™s passwords and access permissions.

member.summary: Gets or sets the permissions.

member.summary: Gets or sets the encryption mode.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.Pdf.Encryption.PdfPermissions
member.summary: This enum represents user's permissions for a pdf.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.Pdf.Encryption.PdfPermissions.PrintDocument
member.summary: (Security handlers of revision 2) Print the document. (Security handlers of revision 3 or greater) Print the document (possibly not at the highest quality level, depending on whether PrintingQuality is also set).

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.Pdf.Encryption.PdfPermissions.ModifyContent
member.summary: Modify the contents of the document by operations other than those controlled by ModifyTextAnnotations, FillForm, and 11.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.Pdf.Encryption.PdfPermissions.ExtractContent
member.summary: Security handlers of revision 2) Copy or otherwise extract text and graphics from the document, including extracting text and graphics (in support of accessibility to users with disabilities or for other purposes). (Security handlers of revision 3 or greater) Copy or otherwise extract text and graphics from the document by operations other than that controlled by ExtractContentWithDisabilities.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.Pdf.Encryption.PdfPermissions.ModifyTextAnnotations
member.summary: Add or modify text annotations, fill in interactive form fields, and, if ModifyContent is also set, create or modify interactive form fields (including signature fields).

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.Pdf.Encryption.PdfPermissions.FillForm
member.summary: (Security handlers of revision 3 or greater) Fill in existing interactive form fields (including signature fields), even if ModifyTextAnnotations is clear.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.Pdf.Encryption.PdfPermissions.ExtractContentWithDisabilities
member.summary: (Security handlers of revision 3 or greater) Extract text and graphics (in support of accessibility to users with disabilities or for other purposes).

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.Pdf.Encryption.PdfPermissions.AssembleDocument
member.summary: (Security handlers of revision 3 or greater) Assemble the document (insert, rotate, or delete pages and create bookmarks or thumbnail images), even if ModifyContent is clear.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Rendering.Pdf.Encryption.PdfPermissions.PrintingQuality
member.summary: (Security handlers of revision 3 or greater) Print the document to a representation from which a faithful digital copy of the PDF content could be generated. When this bit is clear (and bit 3 is set), printing is limited to a low-level representation of the appearance, possibly of degraded quality.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.SVGDocument
member.summary: An SVGDocument is the root of the SVG hierarchy and holds the entire content. Besides providing access to the hierarchy, it also provides some convenience methods for accessing certain sets of information from the document. When an â€˜svgâ€™ element is embedded inline as a component of a document from another namespace, such as when an â€˜svgâ€™ element is embedded inline within an XHTML document [XHTML], then an SVGDocument object will not exist; instead, the root object in the document object hierarchy will be a Document object of a different type, such as an HTMLDocument object. However, an SVGDocument object will indeed exist when the root element of the XML document hierarchy is an â€˜svgâ€™ element, such as when viewing a stand-alone SVG file(i.e., a file with MIME type "image/svg+xml"). In this case, the SVGDocument object will be the root object of the document object model hierarchy.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.SVGGraphicsElement.GetBBox
member.summary: Returns the tight bounding box in current user space (i.e., after application of the â€˜transformâ€™ attribute, if any) on the geometry of all contained graphics elements, exclusive of stroking, clipping, masking and filter effects). Note that getBBox must return the actual bounding box at the time the method was called, even in case the element has not yet been rendered.
member.returns: An SVGRect object that defines the bounding box.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.SVGGraphicsElement.GetCTM
member.summary: Returns the transformation matrix from current user units (i.e., after application of the â€˜transformâ€™ attribute, if any) to the viewport coordinate system for the nearestViewportElement.
member.returns: An SVGMatrix object that defines the CTM.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.SVGGraphicsElement.GetScreenCTM
member.summary: Returns the transformation matrix from current user units (i.e., after application of the â€˜transformâ€™ attribute, if any) to the parent user agent's notice of a "pixel". For display devices, ideally this represents a physical screen pixel. For other devices or environments where physical pixel sizes are not known, then an algorithm similar to the CSS2 definition of a "pixel" can be used instead. Note that null is returned if this element is not hooked into the document tree. This method would have been more aptly named as getClientCTM, but the name getScreenCTM is kept for historical reasons.
member.returns: An SVGMatrix object that defines the given transformation matrix.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.SVGPathElement.PathSegList
member.summary: Provides access to the base (i.e., static) contents of the â€˜dâ€™ attribute in a form which matches one-for-one with SVG's syntax. Thus, if the â€˜dâ€™ attribute has an "absolute moveto (M)" and an "absolute arcto (A)" command, then pathSegList will have two entries: a SVG_PATHSEG_MOVETO_ABS and a SVG_PATHSEG_ARC_ABS.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.SVGPathElement.AnimatedPathSegList
member.summary: Provides access to the current animated contents of the â€˜dâ€™ attribute in a form which matches one-for-one with SVG's syntax. If the given attribute or property is being animated, contains the current animated value of the attribute or property, and both the object itself and its contents are read only. If the given attribute or property is not currently being animated, contains the same value as pathSegList.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.SVGSVGElement
member.summary: A key interface definition is the SVGSVGElement interface, which is the interface that corresponds to the â€˜svgâ€™ element. This interface contains various miscellaneous commonly-used utility methods, such as matrix operations and the ability to control the time of redraw on visual rendering devices.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.SVGSVGElement.PauseAnimations
member.summary: Suspends (i.e., pauses) all currently running animations that are defined within the SVG document fragment corresponding to this â€˜svgâ€™ element, causing the animation clock corresponding to this document fragment to stand still until it is unpaused.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.SVGSVGElement.UnpauseAnimations
member.summary: Unsuspends (i.e., unpauses) currently running animations that are defined within the SVG document fragment, causing the animation clock to continue from the time at which it was suspended.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.SVGSVGElement.AnimationsPaused
member.summary: Returns true if this SVG document fragment is in a paused state.
member.returns: Boolean indicating whether this SVG document fragment is in a paused state.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.SVGSVGElement.GetCurrentTime
member.summary: Returns the current time in seconds relative to the start time for the current SVG document fragment. If getCurrentTime is called before the document timeline has begun (for example, by script running in a â€˜scriptâ€™ element before the document's SVGLoad event is dispatched), then 0 is returned.
member.returns: The current time in seconds, or 0 if the document timeline has not yet begun.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.SVGSVGElement.SetCurrentTime(System.Single)
member.summary: Adjusts the clock for this SVG document fragment, establishing a new current time. If setCurrentTime is called before the document timeline has begun (for example, by script running in a â€˜scriptâ€™ element before the document's SVGLoad event is dispatched), then the value of seconds in the last invocation of the method gives the time that the document will seek to once the document timeline has begun.
member.param: The new current time in seconds relative to the start time for the current SVG document fragment.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.SVGSVGElement.CreateSVGRect

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.SVGSVGElement.CreateSVGTransform
member.summary: Creates an SVGTransform object outside of any document trees. The object is initialized to an identity matrix transform (SVG_TRANSFORM_MATRIX).

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.SVGSVGElement.CreateSVGTransformFromMatrix(Aspose.Svg.DataTypes.SVGMatrix)
member.summary: Creates an SVGTransform object outside of any document trees. The object is initialized to the given matrix transform (i.e., SVG_TRANSFORM_MATRIX). The values from the parameter matrix are copied, the matrix parameter is not adopted as SVGTransform::matrix.
member.param: The transform matrix.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.SVGSVGElement.GetElementById(System.String)
member.summary: Searches this SVG document fragment (i.e., the search is restricted to a subset of the document tree) for an Element whose id is given by elementId. If an Element is found, that Element is returned. If no such element exists, returns null. Behavior is not defined if more than one element has this id.
member.param: The unique id value for an element.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.SVGSVGElement.CreateEvent(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an of a type supported by the implementation.
member.param:
The eventType parameter specifies the type of interface to be created.
If the interface specified is supported by the implementation this method will return a new of the interface type requested. If the is to be dispatched via the method the appropriate method must be called after creation in order to initialize the 's values.
The method is used in creating s when it is either inconvenient or unnecessary for the user to create an themselves. In cases where the implementation provided is insufficient, users may supply their own implementations for use with the method.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.SVGSVGElement.CurrentScale
member.summary: On an outermost svg element, this attribute indicates the current scale factor relative to the initial view to take into account user magnification and panning operations, as described under Magnification and panning. DOM attributes currentScale and currentTranslate are equivalent to the 2x3 matrix [a b c d e f] = [currentScale 0 0 currentScale currentTranslate.x currentTranslate.y]. If "magnification" is enabled (i.e., zoomAndPan="magnify"), then the effect is as if an extra transformation were placed at the outermost level on the SVG document fragment (i.e., outside the outermost svg element). When accessed on an â€˜svgâ€™ element that is not an outermost svg element, it is undefined what behavior this attribute has.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.SVGSVGElement.CurrentTranslate
member.summary: On an outermost svg element, the corresponding translation factor that takes into account user "magnification". When accessed on an â€˜svgâ€™ element that is not an outermost svg element, it is undefined what behavior this attribute has.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.SVGTextContentElement
member.summary: The SVGTextContentElement is inherited by various text-related interfaces, such as SVGTextElement, SVGTSpanElement, SVGTRefElement, SVGAltGlyphElement and SVGTextPathElement. For the methods on this interface that refer to an index to a character or a number of characters, these references are to be interpreted as an index to a UTF-16 code unit or a number of UTF-16 code units, respectively. This is for consistency with DOM Level 2 Core, where methods on the CharacterData interface use UTF-16 code units as indexes and counts within the character data.Thus for example, if the text content of a â€˜textâ€™ element is a single non-BMP character, such as U+10000, then invoking getNumberOfChars on that element will return 2 since there are two UTF-16 code units(the surrogate pair) used to represent that one character.

member.summary: Returns the total number of characters available for rendering within the current element, which includes referenced characters from â€˜trefâ€™ reference, regardless of whether they will be rendered. Effectively, this is equivalent to the length of the Node::textContent attribute from DOM Level 3 Core ([DOM3], section 1.4), if that attribute also expanded â€˜trefâ€™ elements.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.SVGTextContentElement.GetComputedTextLength
member.summary: The total sum of all of the advance values from rendering all of the characters within this element, including the advance value on the glyphs (horizontal or vertical), the effect of properties â€˜kerningâ€™, â€˜letter-spacingâ€™ and â€˜word-spacingâ€™ and adjustments due to attributes â€˜dxâ€™ and â€˜dyâ€™ on â€˜tspanâ€™ elements. For non-rendering environments, the user agent shall make reasonable assumptions about glyph metrics.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers namespace contains classes for optimizing SVG documents. The optimization process involves removing unused or invisible elements and their attributes, merging groups, and reducing the size of path segments.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGOptimizationOptions
member.summary: SVGOptimizationOptions is a class for storing options for optimizing SVG documents.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGOptimizationOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGOptimizationOptions.CollapseGroups
member.summary: Gets or sets the option to collapse excess groups. It is 'true' by default.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGOptimizationOptions.RemoveDescriptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the option to remove only editors content or empty elements. It is 'true' by default.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGOptimizationOptions.RemoveEmptyAttributes
member.summary: Gets or sets the option to remove attributes with empty values. It is 'true' by default.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGOptimizationOptions.RemoveEmptyContainers
member.summary: Gets or sets the option to remove empty containers. It is 'true' by default.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGOptimizationOptions.RemoveEmptyText
member.summary: Gets or sets the option to remove empty Text elements. It is 'true' by default.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGOptimizationOptions.RemoveHiddenElements
member.summary: Gets or sets the option to remove elements that are not visible during rendering. It is 'true' by default.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGOptimizationOptions.RemoveMetadata
member.summary: Gets or sets the option to remove metadata. It is 'true' by default.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGOptimizationOptions.RemoveUnusedNamespaces
member.summary: Gets or sets the option to remove the declaration of unused namespaces from the SVG element that are not used in elements or attributes. It is 'true' by default.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGOptimizationOptions.RemoveUnusedDefs
member.summary: Gets of sets the option to remove the content of defs that are not displayed directly without identifiers. It is 'true' by default.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGOptimizationOptions.RemoveUselessStrokeAndFill
member.summary: Gets of sets the option to remove unused stroke and fill attributes. It is 'true' by default.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGOptimizationOptions.CleanListOfValues
member.summary: Gets or sets the option for rounding to 3 decimal places of list numeric values in attributes. It is 'true' by default.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGOptimizationOptions.RemoveIndentsAndLineBreaks
member.summary: Gets or sets the option to remove line indents and breaks. It is 'true' by default.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGOptimizationOptions.PathOptimizationOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the option . If this option is null, then path element optimization will not be performed.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGOptimizer
member.summary: SVGOptimizer is a static class designed to optimize SVG documents. By optimization, we mean removing unused or invisible elements and their attributes, merging groups, and reducing the size of path segments.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGOptimizer.Optimize(Aspose.Svg.SVGDocument)
member.summary: Optimizes by applying a set of default optimization options.
member.param: The instance of SVGDocument.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGOptimizer.Optimize(Aspose.Svg.SVGDocument,Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGOptimizationOptions)
member.summary: Optimizes by applying a set of specified optimization options.
member.param: The instance of SVGDocument.
The instance of SVGOptimizationOptions.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGPathOptimizationOptions
member.summary: SVGPathOptimizationOptions is a class for storing options for optimizing segments of SVG path elements.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGPathOptimizationOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGPathOptimizationOptions.RemoveSpaceAfterFlags
member.summary: Gets or sets the option to remove extra space after 'arcto' command flags. It is 'false' by default.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGPathOptimizationOptions.ApplyTransforms
member.summary: Gets or sets the option to apply transformations to the Path segments. It is 'false' by default.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGPathOptimizationOptions.FloatPrecision
member.summary: Gets or sets the option to round a float-precision floating-point value to a specified number of fractional digits. It is '3' by default.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGPathOptimizationOptions.ArcBuildingThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the parameter value used as the threshold error for replacing Bezier segments with arc segments. It is '2.5' by default.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Toolkit.Optimizers.SVGPathOptimizationOptions.ArcBuildingTolerance
member.summary: Gets or sets the parameter value used as the percentage of radius for replacing Bezier segments with arc segments. It is '0.5' by default.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Saving.SVGSaveFormat
member.summary: Specifies format in which document is saved.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.Saving.SVGSaveFormat.SVG
member.summary: Document will be saved as SVG.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Saving.SVGSaveOptions
member.summary: Represents SVG save options.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Saving.SVGSaveOptions.VectorizeText
member.summary: Gets or sets whether text elements are replaced with paths.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Paths.ISVGAnimatedPathData
member.summary: he SVGAnimatedPathData interface supports elements which have a â€˜dâ€™ attribute which holds SVG path data, and supports the ability to animate that attribute.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Paths.ISVGAnimatedPathData.PathSegList
member.summary: Provides access to the base (i.e., static) contents of the â€˜dâ€™ attribute in a form which matches one-for-one with SVG's syntax. Thus, if the â€˜dâ€™ attribute has an "absolute moveto (M)" and an "absolute arcto (A)" command, then pathSegList will have two entries: a SVG_PATHSEG_MOVETO_ABS and a SVG_PATHSEG_ARC_ABS.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Paths.ISVGAnimatedPathData.AnimatedPathSegList
member.summary: Provides access to the current animated contents of the â€˜dâ€™ attribute in a form which matches one-for-one with SVG's syntax. If the given attribute or property is being animated, contains the current animated value of the attribute or property, and both the object itself and its contents are read only. If the given attribute or property is not currently being animated, contains the same value as pathSegList.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Paths.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The Aspose.Svg.Dom.Svg.Paths namespace describes classes for representation of outline of a shape which can be filled or stroked. A path can also be used as a clipping path, to describe animation, or position text.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Events.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace consists of classes for event based interactivity like time events and zooming.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Events.SVGZoomEvent
member.summary: The zoom event occurs when the user initiates an action which causes the current view of the SVG document fragment to be rescaled. Event handlers are only recognized on â€˜svgâ€™ elements.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Events.SVGZoomEvent.ZoomRectScreen
member.summary: The specified zoom rectangle in screen units. The SVGRect object is read only.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Events.SVGZoomEvent.PreviousScale
member.summary: The scale factor from previous zoom operations that was in place before the zoom operation occurred.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Events.SVGZoomEvent.PreviousTranslate
member.summary: The translation values from previous zoom operations that were in place before the zoom operation occurred. The SVGPoint object is read only.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Events.SVGZoomEvent.NewScale
member.summary: The scale factor that will be in place after the zoom operation has been processed.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Events.SVGZoomEvent.NewTranslate
member.summary: The translation values that will be in place after the zoom operation has been processed. The SVGPoint object is read only.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.Events.TimeEvent
member.summary: The TimeEvent interface provides specific contextual information associated with Time events.The different types of events that can occur are: beginEvent, endEvent and repeatEvent.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.Events.TimeEvent.InitTimeEvent(System.String,Aspose.Svg.Dom.Views.IAbstractView,System.Int64)
member.summary: The initTimeEvent method is used to initialize the value of a TimeEvent created through the DocumentEvent interface. This method may only be called before the TimeEvent has been dispatched via the dispatchEvent method, though it may be called multiple times during that phase if necessary. If called multiple times, the final invocation takes precedence.
member.param: Specifies the event type.
Specifies the Event's AbstractView.
Specifies the Event's detail.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Events.TimeEvent.View
member.summary: The view attribute identifies the AbstractView [DOM2VIEWS] from which the event was generated.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.Events.TimeEvent.Detail
member.summary: Specifies some detail information about the Event, depending on the type of the event. For this event type, indicates the repeat number for the animation.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.DataTypes.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace provides access to all SVG specific data types.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.DataTypes.SVGAngle
member.summary: The SVGAngle interface corresponds to the angle basic data type.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.DataTypes.SVGAngle.SVG_ANGLETYPE_UNKNOWN
member.summary: The unit type is not one of predefined unit types. It is invalid to attempt to define a new value of this type or to attempt to switch an existing value to this type.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.DataTypes.SVGAngle.SVG_ANGLETYPE_UNSPECIFIED
member.summary: No unit type was provided (i.e., a unitless value was specified). For angles, a unitless value is treated the same as if degrees were specified.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.DataTypes.SVGAngle.SVG_ANGLETYPE_DEG
member.summary: The unit type was explicitly set to degrees.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.DataTypes.SVGAngle.SVG_ANGLETYPE_RAD
member.summary: The unit type is radians.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.DataTypes.SVGAngle.SVG_ANGLETYPE_GRAD
member.summary: The unit type is radians.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.DataTypes.SVGAngle.NewValueSpecifiedUnits(System.UInt16,System.Single)
member.summary: Reset the value as a number with an associated unitType, thereby replacing the values for all of the attributes on the object.
member.exception: Code Raised if unitType is SVG_ANGLETYPE_UNKNOWN or not a valid unit type constant (one of the other SVG_ANGLETYPE_* constants defined on this interface).
Code Raised when the angle corresponds to a read only attribute or when the object itself is read only.
member.param: The unit type for the value (e.g., SVG_ANGLETYPE_DEG).
The angle value.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.DataTypes.SVGAngle.ConvertToSpecifiedUnits(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Preserve the same underlying stored value, but reset the stored unit identifier to the given unitType. Object attributes unitType, valueInSpecifiedUnits and valueAsString might be modified as a result of this method.
member.exception: Code Raised if unitType is SVG_ANGLETYPE_UNKNOWN or not a valid unit type constant (one of the other SVG_ANGLETYPE_* constants defined on this interface).
Code Raised when the angle corresponds to a read only attribute or when the object itself is read only.
member.param: The unit type to switch to (e.g., SVG_ANGLETYPE_DEG).

member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.DataTypes.SVGAngle.UnitType
member.summary: The type of the value as specified by one of the SVG_ANGLETYPE_* constants defined on this interface.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.DataTypes.SVGAngle.Value
member.summary: The angle value as a floating point value, in degrees. Setting this attribute will cause valueInSpecifiedUnits and valueAsString to be updated automatically to reflect this setting.
member.exception: Code Raised when the angle corresponds to a read only attribute or when the object itself is read only.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.DataTypes.SVGAngle.ValueInSpecifiedUnits
member.summary: The angle value as a floating point value, in the units expressed by unitType. Setting this attribute will cause value and valueAsString to be updated automatically to reflect this setting.
member.exception: Code Raised when the angle corresponds to a read only attribute or when the object itself is read only.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.DataTypes.SVGAngle.ValueAsString
member.summary: The angle value as a string value, in the units expressed by unitType. Setting this attribute will cause value, valueInSpecifiedUnits and unitType to be updated automatically to reflect this setting.
member.exception: Code Raised if the assigned string cannot be parsed as a valid angle.
Code Raised when the angle corresponds to a read only attribute or when the object itself is read only.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.DataTypes.SVGLength
member.summary: The SVGLength interface corresponds to the length basic data type. An SVGLength object can be designated as read only, which means that attempts to modify the object will result in an exception being thrown, as described below.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.DataTypes.SVGLength.SVG_LENGTHTYPE_UNKNOWN
member.summary: The unit type is not one of predefined unit types. It is invalid to attempt to define a new value of this type or to attempt to switch an existing value to this type.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.DataTypes.SVGLength.SVG_LENGTHTYPE_NUMBER
member.summary: No unit type was provided (i.e., a unitless value was specified), which indicates a value in user units.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.DataTypes.SVGLength.SVG_LENGTHTYPE_PERCENTAGE
member.summary: A percentage value was specified.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.DataTypes.SVGLength.SVG_LENGTHTYPE_EMS
member.summary: A value was specified using the em units defined in CSS2.

member.name: F:Aspose.Svg.DataTypes.SVGLength.SVG_LENGTHTYPE_EXS
member.summary: A value was specified using the ex units defined in CSS2.

member.summary: A value was specified using the px units defined in CSS2.

member.summary: A value was specified using the cm units defined in CSS2.

member.summary: A value was specified using the mm units defined in CSS2.

member.summary: A value was specified using the pc units defined in CSS2.

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.DataTypes.SVGLength.NewValueSpecifiedUnits(System.UInt16,System.Single)
member.summary: Reset the value as a number with an associated unitType, thereby replacing the values for all of the attributes on the object.
member.exception: Code Raised if unitType is SVG_LENGTHTYPE_UNKNOWN or not a valid unit type constant (one of the other SVG_LENGTHTYPE_* constants defined on this interface).
Code Raised when the length corresponds to a read only attribute or when the object itself is read only.
member.param: The unit type for the value.
The new value..

member.name: M:Aspose.Svg.DataTypes.SVGLength.ConvertToSpecifiedUnits(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Preserve the same underlying stored value, but reset the stored unit identifier to the given unitType. Object attributes unitType, valueInSpecifiedUnits and valueAsString might be modified as a result of this method. For example, if the original value were "0.5cm" and the method was invoked to convert to millimeters, then the unitType would be changed to SVG_LENGTHTYPE_MM, valueInSpecifiedUnits would be changed to the numeric value 5 and valueAsString would be changed to "5mm".
member.exception: Code Raised if unitType is SVG_LENGTHTYPE_UNKNOWN or not a valid unit type constant (one of the other SVG_LENGTHTYPE_* constants defined on this interface).
Code Raised when the length corresponds to a read only attribute or when the object itself is read only.
member.param: The unit type to switch to (e.g., SVG_LENGTHTYPE_MM).

member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.

member.summary: The type of the value as specified by one of the SVG_LENGTHTYPE_* constants defined on this interface.

member.summary: The value as a floating point value, in user units. Setting this attribute will cause valueInSpecifiedUnits and valueAsString to be updated automatically to reflect this setting.

member.summary: The type of the value as specified by one of the SVG_TRANSFORM_* constants defined on this interface.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.DataTypes.SVGTransform.Matrix
member.summary: The matrix that represents this transformation. The matrix object is live, meaning that any changes made to the SVGTransform object are immediately reflected in the matrix object and vice versa. In case the matrix object is changed directly (i.e., without using the methods on the SVGTransform interface itself) then the type of the SVGTransform changes to SVG_TRANSFORM_MATRIX. For SVG_TRANSFORM_MATRIX, the matrix contains the a, b, c, d, e, f values supplied by the user. For SVG_TRANSFORM_TRANSLATE, e and f represent the translation amounts(a= 1, b= 0, c= 0 and d = 1). For SVG_TRANSFORM_SCALE, a and d represent the scale amounts(b= 0, c= 0, e= 0 and f = 0). For SVG_TRANSFORM_SKEWX and SVG_TRANSFORM_SKEWY, a, b, c and d represent the matrix which will result in the given skew(e= 0 and f = 0). For SVG_TRANSFORM_ROTATE, a, b, c, d, e and f together represent the matrix which will result in the given rotation.When the rotation is around the center point(0, 0), e and f will be zero.
member.value: The matrix that represents this transformation.

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.DataTypes.SVGTransform.Angle
member.summary: A convenience attribute for SVG_TRANSFORM_ROTATE, SVG_TRANSFORM_SKEWX and SVG_TRANSFORM_SKEWY. It holds the angle that was specified. For SVG_TRANSFORM_MATRIX, SVG_TRANSFORM_TRANSLATE and SVG_TRANSFORM_SCALE, angle will be zero.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.ImageVectorization.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The Aspose.Svg.ImageVectorization namespace contains classes for vectorizing raster images and converting them to SVG documents. This process involves reducing bitmaps to geometric shapes made up from path elements and storing them as SVG. The namespace includes classes for building path segments, simplifying and smoothing trace points, and configuring vectorization options.

member.name: T:Aspose.Svg.ImageVectorization.SplinePathBuilder
member.summary: The class is responsible for building path segments from list of the trace points. This path builder is based on applying a Catmull-Roma spline to a set of smoothed and reduced path points..

member.name: P:Aspose.Svg.ImageVectorization.SplinePathBuilder.Tension
member.summary: The value of the tensions affects how sharply the curve bends at the (interpolated) control points. It must be in the range from 0 to 1. Any higher or lower values will be aligned with the minimum and maximum values of this range, accordingly.
